[A servant]623-a servant - [a sort of special edition of [[James]74-james 's Georgiana]878-james 's georgiana]877-a sort of special edition of james 's georgiana - appeared , and robbed [everybody]302-everybody of every garment that would yield easily to pulling . And then [those lovely creatures]880-those lovely creatures stood revealed . Yes , [Sarah]107-sarah [herself]107-sarah was lovely under the rosy shades . [The young men]881-the young men were elegantly slim , and looked very much alike , except that [Adams]124-adams had a beard - a feeble beard , but a beard . [His]74-james wide black necktie was the secret envy of [the Swetnam boys]886-the swetnam boys .

[The Swetnam boys]886-the swetnam boys had the air of doing now what [they]886-the swetnam boys did every night of [their]886-the swetnam boys lives . With facile ease , [they]886-the swetnam boys led the way through [the long hall]888-the long hall to [the drawing - room]889-the drawing - room . " [Male and female]2080-male and female created [He]95-emanuel [them]891-two young people ! "[74-james] reflected [James]74-james , with all the tolerant , disdainful wisdom of [his]74-james years and situation .

A piano was then heard , and as [Ronald Swetnam]123-ronald pushed open the drawing - room door for [the women]892-the women to enter , there came the sound of a shocked " S - sh ! "[123-ronald]

Whereupon [the invaders]893-the invaders took to the tips of [their]893-the invaders toes and crept in as [sinners]894-sinners . At the farther end [a girl]248-a girl was sitting at a grand piano , and in front of the piano , glorious , effulgent , monarchical , stood [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel , holding a piece of music horizontally at the level of [his]95-emanuel waist . [He]95-emanuel had a white flower in [his]95-emanuel buttonhole , and , adhering to a quaint old custom which still lingers in [the Five Towns]193-the five towns , and possibly elsewhere , [he]95-emanuel showed a crimson silk handkerchief tucked in between [his]95-emanuel shirt - front and [his]95-emanuel white waistcoat . [He]95-emanuel had broad bands down the sides of [his]95-emanuel trousers . Not a hair of [his]95-emanuel head had been touched by the accidental winds of circumstance . [He]95-emanuel surveyed [the couple of dozen people in [the large , glowing room]898-the large , glowing room]897-the couple of dozen people in the large , glowing room with a fixed smile and gesture of benevolent congratulation .

[Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter was close to the door . " [Emanuel]95-emanuel is just going to sing , "[84-mrs. prockter] [she]84-mrs. prockter whispered , and shook hands silently with [James Ollerenshaw]74-james first .

Contents Chapter 14

SONG , SCENE AND DANCE

Every head was turned . [Emanuel]95-emanuel coughed , frowned , and put [his]95-emanuel left hand between [his]95-emanuel collar and [his]95-emanuel neck , as though [he]95-emanuel had concealed something there . [The new arrivals]899-the new arrivals slipped cautiously into chairs . [James]74-james was between [Helen]79-helen and [Jos]126-jos . And [he]74-james distinctly saw [Jos]126-jos wink at [Helen]79-helen , and [Helen]79-helen wink back . The winks were without doubt an expression of sentiments aroused by the solemnity of [Emanuel]95-emanuel 's frown .

The piano tinkled on , and then [Emanuel]95-emanuel 's face was observed to change . The frown vanished and a smile of heavenly rapture took its place . [His]95-emanuel mouth gradually opened till its resemblance to the penultimate vowel was quite realistic , and simultaneously , by a curious muscular co - ordination , [he]95-emanuel rose on [his]95-emanuel toes to a considerable height in the air .

The strain was terrible - like waiting for a gun to go off . [James]74-james was conscious of a strange vibration by [his]74-james side , and saw that [Jos Swetman]127-jos swetman had got the whole of a lace handkerchief into [her]127-jos swetman mouth .

The gun went off - not with a loud report , but with a gentle and lofty tenor piping , somewhere in [the neighbourhood of F]900-the neighbourhood of f , or it might have been only E though , indeed , a. photograph would have suggested that [Emanuel]95-emanuel was singing at lowest the upper C , and [the performer]901-the performer slowly resumed [his]95-emanuel normal stature .

" O Love ! "[95-emanuel] [he]95-emanuel had exclaimed , adagio and sostenuto .

Then the piano , in [its]902-its fashion , also said : " O Love ! "[902-its]

" O Love ! "[95-emanuel] [Emanuel]95-emanuel exclaimed again , with slight traces of excitement , and rising to heights of stature hitherto undreamt of .

And the piano once more , in turn , called plaintively on love .

It would be too easy to mock [Emanuel]95-emanuel 's gift of song . [I]0-i leave that to [people named [Swetnam]126-jos]903-people named swetnam . There can be no doubt [Emanuel]95-emanuel had a very taking voice , if thin , and that [his]95-emanuel singing gave pleasure to [the majority of [[his]95-emanuel hearers]905-his hearers]904-the majority of his hearers . More than [any one else]906-any one else , it pleased [himself]95-emanuel . When [he]95-emanuel sang [he]95-emanuel seemed to be inspired by the fact , to [him]95-emanuel patent , that [he]95-emanuel was conferring on [mankind]907-mankind a boon inconceivably precious . If [he]95-emanuel looked [a fool]1982-a fool , [his]95-emanuel looks seriously misinterpreted [his]95-emanuel feelings . [He]95-emanuel did not spare [himself]95-emanuel on that evening . [He]95-emanuel told [[his]95-emanuel stepmother]909-his stepmother 's guests all about love and all about [his]95-emanuel own yearnings . [He]95-emanuel hid nothing from [them]910-them . [He]95-emanuel made no secret of the fact that [he]95-emanuel lived for love alone , that [he]95-emanuel had known innumerable loves , but none like one particular variety , which [he]95-emanuel described in full detail . As a confession , and especially as a confession uttered before [many maidens]911-many maidens , it did not err on the side of reticence . Presently , having described a kind of amorous circle , [he]95-emanuel came again to : " O Love ! "[95-emanuel]

But this time [his]95-emanuel voice cracked : which made [him]95-emanuel angry , with a stern and controlled anger . Still singing , [he]95-emanuel turned slowly to [the pianist]912-the pianist , and fiercely glared at [the pianist]912-the pianist 's unconscious back . The obvious inference was that if [his]95-emanuel voice had cracked the fault was [the pianist]912-the pianist 's . [The pianist]912-the pianist , poor thing , utterly unaware of the castigation [she]912-the pianist was receiving , stuck to [her]912-the pianist business . Less than a minute later , [Emanuel]95-emanuel 's voice cracked again . This time [he]95-emanuel turned even more deliberately to [the pianist]912-the pianist . [He]95-emanuel was pained . [He]95-emanuel stared during five complete bars at the back of [the pianist]912-the pianist , still continuing [his]95-emanuel confession . [He]95-emanuel wished [the audience]918-the audience to understand clearly where the blame lay . Finally , when [he]95-emanuel thought [the pianist]912-the pianist 's back was sufficiently cooked , [he]95-emanuel faced [the audience]918-the audience .

" [I]95-emanuel hope [the pianist]912-the pianist will not be so atrociously clumsy as to let [my]95-emanuel voice crack again , "[95-emanuel] [he]95-emanuel seemed to be saying .

Evidently [his]95-emanuel reproof to [the pianist]912-the pianist 's back was effectual , for [his]95-emanuel voice did not crack again .

And at length , when [Jos]126-jos had communicated [her]922-her vibration to all [[her]922-her family]923-her family , and [every one]924-every one had ceased to believe that the confession would ever end , the confession did end . It ended as it had begun , in an even , agreeable tenor piping . [Emanuel]95-emanuel was much too great [an artist]925-an artist to allow [himself]95-emanuel to be carried away by [his]95-emanuel emotion . The concluding words were , " Oh , rapture ! "[95-emanuel] and [Emanuel]95-emanuel sang them just as if [he]95-emanuel had been singing " One - and - eleven - pence three - farthings . "[95-emanuel]

" Oh , rats ! "[126-jos] said [Jos]126-jos , under cover of the impassioned applause .

" It was nearly as long as [Jarndyce]120-jarndyce v. [Jarndyce]120-jarndyce , "[124-adams] observed [Adams]124-adams , under the same cover .

" What ! "[74-james] cried [James]74-james , enchanted . " Have [you]124-adams been reading that too ? "[74-james]

[Adams Swetnam]124-adams and great - stepuncle [James]74-james had quite a little chat on the subject of [Jarndyce]120-jarndyce v. [Jarndyce]120-jarndyce . " Oh , here 's [Andrew]113-andrew , [Helen]79-helen ! "[107-sarah] [Sarah]107-sarah exclaimed .

[Andrew Dean]113-andrew had the air of [a formidable personage]934-a formidable personage . [He]113-andrew was [a tall , heavy , dark young man]935-a tall , heavy , dark young man , with immense sloping shoulders , a black moustache , and incandescent eyes , which [he]113-andrew used as though [he]113-andrew were somewhat suspicious of [the world]220-the world in general . The episode was quite negative ; but it amounted to a scene - a scene at one of [[Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter 's parties]939-mrs. prockter 's parties ! A scene , moreover , that mystified [everybody]302-everybody ; a scene that implied war and [the wounded]841-the wounded !

[Some]942-some discreetly withdrew . Of these was [Emanuel]95-emanuel , who had the sensitiveness of [an artist]925-an artist .

[Andrew Dean]113-andrew presently perceived , after standing for some seconds like an imbecile stork on one leg , that the discretion of [the others]944-the others was worthy to be imitated . Within a quarter of an hour a fete unique in the annals of [Hillport]23-hillport had organised [itself]972-itself on the lawn in [the dim , verdurous retreats behind [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter 's house]973-the dim , verdurous retreats behind mrs. prockter 's house . [The lawn]2090-the lawn was large enough to be just too small for [a tennis - court]975-a tennis - court . [It]2090-the lawn was also of a pretty mid - Victorian irregularity as regards shape , and guarded from the grim horizons of [the Five Towns by a ring of superb elms]976-the five towns by a ring of superb elms . [A dozen couples]977-a dozen couples , mainly youngish , promenaded upon [its]2090-the lawn impeccable surface in obvious expectation ; while on the borders , in rustic chairs , odd remnants of [humanity , mainly oldish]978-humanity , mainly oldish , gazed in ecstasy at the picturesque ensemble . In the midst of [the lawn]2090-the lawn was [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter 's famous weeping willow , on whose branches Chinese lanterns had been hung by [a reluctant gardener , who held to the proper gardener]980-a reluctant gardener , who held to the proper gardener 's axiom that lawns are made to be seen and not hurt . The moon aided these lanterns to the best of [her]84-mrs. prockter power . Under the tree was a cane chair , and on the cane chair sat [an ageing man with a concertina]981-an ageing man with a concertina .between [his]981-an ageing man with a concertina hands . [He]981-an ageing man with a concertina put [his]981-an ageing man with a concertina head on one side and played a few bars , and [the couples]982-the couples posed [themselves]982-the couples expectantly .

" Hold on a bit ! "[983-the virtuoso] [the virtuoso]983-the virtuoso called out . " It 's a tidy bit draughty here . "[983-the virtuoso]

[He]981-an ageing man with a concertina put the concertina on [his]981-an ageing man with a concertina knees , fumbled in [his]981-an ageing man with a concertina tail - pocket , and drew forth a tasseled Turkish cap , which majestically [he]981-an ageing man with a concertina assumed ; the tassel fell over [his]981-an ageing man with a concertina forehead . [He]981-an ageing man with a concertina owned several Turkish caps , and never went abroad without one .

Then be struck up definitely , and [[Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter 's party]850-mrs. prockter 's party had resolved itself , as parties often do , into a dance . In the blissful excitation caused by the ancient and jiggy tunes which " [Jimmy]74-james "[84-mrs. prockter] played , the sad episode of [Helen Rathbone]79-helen and [Andrew Dean]113-andrew appeared to be forgotten . [Helen]79-helen danced with [every man]985-every man except [Andrew]113-andrew , and [Andrew]113-andrew danced with [every woman except [Helen]79-helen]986-every woman except helen . But [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter had not forgotten the episode ; nor had [the Misses Webber]133-the misses webber . The reputation of [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter 's entertainments for utter correctness , and [her]84-mrs. prockter own enormous reputation for fine tact , were impaired , and [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter was determined that that which ought to happen should happen .

[She]84-mrs. prockter had a brief and exceedingly banal interview with [Helen]79-helen , and another with [Andrew]113-andrew . And an interval having elapsed , [Andrew]113-andrew was observed to approach [Helen]79-helen and ask [her]79-helen for a polka . [Helen]79-helen punctiliously accepted . And [he]113-andrew led [her]79-helen out . [The outraged gods of social decorum]987-the outraged gods of social decorum were appeased , and the reputations of [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter and [her]84-mrs. prockter parties stood as high as ever . It was well and diplomatically done .

Nevertheless , the unforeseen came to pass . For at the end of the polka [Helen]79-helen fainted on the grass ; and not [Andrew]113-andrew but [Emanuel]95-emanuel was first to succour [her]79-helen . It was a highly disconcerting climax . Of course , [Helen]79-helen , being [Helen]79-helen , recovered with singular rapidity . But that did not lighten the mystery .

In [the cab]988-the cab , going [home]1773-home , [she]79-helen wept . [James]74-james could scarcely have believed it of [her]79-helen .

" Oh , [uncle]1867-uncle , "[79-helen] [she]79-helen half whispered , in a voice of grief , " [you]1867-uncle fiddled while [Rome]36-rome was burning ! "[79-helen]

This obscure saying baffled [him]74-james , the more so that [he]74-james had been playing a concertina and not a fiddle at all . [His]74-james feelings were vague , and in some respects contradictory ; but [he]74-james was convinced that [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter 's scheme for separating [Helen]79-helen and [the Apollo Emanuel]990-the apollo emanuel was not precisely succeeding .

Contents Chapter 15

THE GIFT

After that night great - stepuncle [James]74-james became more than [a celebrity]991-a celebrity - [he]74-james became [a notoriety in [Bursley]1-bursley]992-a notoriety in bursley . Had it not been for the personal influence of [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter with [the editor of the Signal]993-the editor of the signal , [James]74-james 's exploits upon the concertina under weeping willows at midnight would have received facetious comment in the weekly column of gossip that appears in the great daily organ of [the Five Towns]193-the five towns on Saturdays . [James]74-james , aided by nothing but a glass or two of champagne , had suddenly stepped into the forefront of [the town]224-the town 's life . [He]74-james was a card . [He]74-james rather liked being a card .

But within [his]74-james own heart the triumph and glory of [James Ollerenshaw]74-james were less splendid than outside it . [Helen]79-helen , apparently ashamed of having wept into [his]74-james waistcoat , kept [him]74-james off with a kind of a rod of stiff politeness . [He]74-james could not get near [her]79-helen , and for at least two reasons [he]74-james was anxious to get near [her]79-helen . [He]74-james wanted to have that frank , confidential talk with [her]79-helen about the general imbecility of [[her]79-helen adorer]996-her adorer , [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel , that talk which [he]74-james had failed to begin on the morning when [she]79-helen had been so sympathetic concerning [his]74-james difficulties in collecting a large income . [Her]79-helen movements from day to day were mysterious . Facts pointed to the probability that [she]79-helen and [Emanuel]95-emanuel were seeing [each other]456-each other with no undue publicity . And yet , despite facts , despite [her]79-helen behaviour at the party , [he]74-james could scarcely believe that [shrewd Helen]79-helen had not pierced the skin of [Emanuel]95-emanuel and perceived the emptiness therein . At any rate , [Emanuel]95-emanuel had not repeated [his]95-emanuel visit to [the house]475-the house . [The only visitors]999-the only visitors had been [Sarah Swetnam]107-sarah and [[her]107-sarah sister]864-her sister [Lilian]112-lilian , [the fiancée of [Andrew Dean]113-andrew]1001-the fiancée of andrew dean . The chatter of [the three girls]1002-the three girls had struck [James]74-james as being almost hysterically gay . But in the evening [Helen]79-helen was very gloomy , and [he]74-james fancied a certain redness in [her]79-helen eyes . Though [Helen]79-helen was assuredly [the last woman in [the world]220-the world]1003-the last woman in the world to cry , [she]79-helen had , beyond doubt , cried once , and [he]74-james now suspected [her]79-helen of another weeping .

Even more detrimental to [his]74-james triumph in [his]74-james own heart was the affair of the ten - pound note , which [she]79-helen had stolen or abstracted if [you]1005-you will and then restored to [him]74-james with such dramatic haughtiness . That ten pounds was an awful trial to [him]74-james . It rankled , not only with [him]74-james , but [he]74-james felt sure with [her]79-helen . Still , if [she]79-helen had [her]79-helen pride , [he]74-james also had [his]74-james . [He]74-james reckoned that [she]79-helen had not rightly behaved in taking the note without [his]74-james permission , and that in returning the full sum , and pretending that [he]74-james had made it necessary for [her]79-helen to run [the house]475-the house on [her]79-helen own money , [she]79-helen had treated [him]74-james meanly . The truth was , [she]79-helen had wounded [him]74-james - again . Instincts of astounding generosity were budding in [him]74-james , but [he]74-james was determined to await an advance from [her]79-helen . [He]74-james gave [her]79-helen money for housekeeping , within moderation , and nothing more .

Then one evening [she]79-helen announced that the morrow would be [her]79-helen birthday . [James]74-james felt uneasy . [He]74-james had never given birthday presents , but [he]74-james well knew that presents were the correct things on birthdays . [He]74-james went to bed in a state of the most absurd and causeless mental disturbance . [He]74-james did not know what to do . Whereas it was enormously obvious what to do .

[He]74-james woke up about one o'clock , and reflected , with an air of discovery : " [Her]79-helen tone was extremely friendly when [she]79-helen told [me]74-james it was [her]79-helen birthday to - morrow . [She]79-helen meant it as an advance . [I]74-james shall take it as an advance . "[74-james]

About half - past one [he]74-james said to [himself]74-james : " [I]74-james 'll give [her]79-helen a guinea to spend as [she]79-helen likes . "[74-james] It did genuinely seem to [him]74-james a vast sum . A guinea to fritter away !

However , towards three o'clock its vastness had shrunk .

" Dashed if [I]74-james do n't give [the wench]2102-the wench a fiver ! "[74-james] [he]74-james exclaimed . It was madness , but [he]74-james had an obscure feeling that [he]74-james might have had more amusement if [he]74-james had begun being mad rather earlier in life .

Upon this [he]74-james slept soundly till six o'clock .

[His]74-james mind then unfortunately got entangled in the painful episode of the ten - pound note . [He]74-james and [Helen]79-helen had the same blood in [their]1007-their veins . [They]1007-their were alike in some essential traits . [He]74-james knew that neither of [them]1007-their could ever persuade [himself]74-james , or [herself]79-helen , to mention that miserable ten - pound note again .

" If [I]74-james gave [her]79-helen a tenner , "[74-james] [he]74-james said , " that would make [her]79-helen see as [I]74-james 'd settled to forget that business , and let bygones be bygones . [I]74-james 'll give [her]79-helen a tenner . "[74-james]

It was preposterous . [She]79-helen could not , of course , spend it . [She]79-helen would put it away . So it would not be wasted .

Upon this [he]74-james rose .

[Poor simpleton]134-poor simpleton ! Ever since the commencement of [his]74-james relations with [Helen]79-helen , surprise had followed surprise for [him]74-james . And the series was not ended .

The idea of giving a gift made [him]74-james quite nervous . [He]74-james fumbled in [his]74-james cashbox for quite

a long time , and then be called , nervously :

" [Helen]79-helen ! "[74-james]

[She]79-helen came out of [the kitchen]490-the kitchen into [the front room]1881-the front room . Dress : White muslin - unspeakable extravagance in [a town of smuts]1010-a town of smuts .

" It 's [thy]79-helen birthday , [lass]1738-lass ? "[79-helen]

[She]79-helen nodded , smiling .

" Well , tak ' this . "[79-helen]

[He]74-james handed [her]79-helen a ten - pound note .

" Oh , thank [you]74-james , [uncle]1867-uncle ! "[79-helen] [she]79-helen cried , just on the calm side of effusiveness .

At this point the surprise occurred .

There was another ten - pound note in the cashbox . [His]74-james fingers went for a stroll on [their]1011-their own account and returned with that note .

" Hold on ! "[74-james] [he]74-james admonished [her]79-helen for jumping to conclusions . " And this ! "[74-james] And [he]74-james gave [her]79-helen a second note . [He]74-james was much more startled than [she]79-helen was .

" Oh , thank [you]74-james , [uncle]1867-uncle ! "[74-james] And then , laughing : " Why , it 's nearly a sovereign for every year of [my]74-james life ! "[74-james]

" How old art ? "[74-james]

" Twenty - six . "[74-james]

" [I]74-james 'm gone dotty ! "[74-james] [he]74-james said to [his]74-james soul . " [I]74-james 'm gone dotty ! "[74-james] And [his]74-james eyes watched [his]74-james fingers take six sovereigns out of the box , and count them into [her]79-helen small white hand . And [his]74-james cheek felt [her]79-helen kiss .

[She]79-helen went off with twenty - six pounds - twenty - six pounds ! The episode was entirely incredible .

Breakfast was a most pleasing meal . Though acknowledging [himself]74-james an imbecile , [he]74-james was obliged to acknowledge also that a certain pleasure springs from a certain sort of imbecility . [Helen]79-helen was adorable .

Now that same morning [he]74-james had received from [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter a flattering note , asking [him]74-james , if [he]74-james cou1d spare the time , to go up to [Hillport]23-hillport and examine [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall with [her]84-mrs. prockter , and give [her]84-mrs. prockter [his]74-james expert advice as to its value , etc . [He]74-james informed [Helen]79-helen of the plan .

" [I]79-helen 'll go with [you]74-james , "[79-helen] [she]79-helen said at once .

" What 's in the wind ? "[74-james] [he]74-james asked [himself]74-james . [He]74-james saw in the suggestion a device for seeing [Emanuel]95-emanuel .

" The fact is , "[79-helen] [she]79-helen added , " [I]79-helen want to show [you]74-james [a house up at [Hillport]23-hillport that might do for [us]2107-us]2106-a house up at hillport that might do for us . '[79-helen]

[He]74-james winced . [She]79-helen had said nothing about a removal for quite some time . [He]74-james hated the notion of removal . " Flitting , "[74-james] [he]74-james called it . It would mean extra expense , too . As for [Hillport]23-hillport , [he]74-james was sure that nothing , except [cottages]1012-cottages , could be got in [Hillport]23-hillport for less than fifty pounds a year . If [she]79-helen thought [he]74-james was going to increase [his]74-james rent by thirty - two pounds a year , besides rates , [she]79-helen was in error . The breakfast finished in a slight mist . [He]74-james hardened . The idea of [her]79-helen indicating [houses]2060-houses to [him]74-james ! The idea of [her]79-helen assuming that - Well , no use in meeting trouble half - way !

[THE HALL]2083-the hall AND [ITS]2083-the hall RESULT

" Yes , "[84-mrs. prockter] said [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter , gazing about [her]84-mrs. prockter , to [James Ollerenshaw]74-james , " [it]2083-the hall certainly is rather spacious . "[84-mrs. prockter]

" Rather spacious ! "[74-james] [James]74-james repeated in the secret hollows of [his]74-james mind . It was not spacious ; it was simply fantastic . [They]1015-they stood , those two - [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter in [her]84-mrs. prockter usual flowered silk , and [James]74-james in [his]74-james usual hard , rent - collecting clothes - at the foot of the double staircase , which sprang with the light of elegance of wings from the floor of [the entrance - hall of [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall]1016-the entrance - hall of wilbraham hall . In front of [them]1015-they , over the great door , was a [musicians]1017-musicians ' gallery , and over that a huge window . On either side of the great door were narrow windows which looked over [stretches of green country far away from [the Five Towns]193-the five towns]1018-stretches of green country far away from the five towns . For [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall was on [the supreme ridge of [Hillport]23-hillport]1020-the supreme ridge of hillport , and presented only [[its]34-wilbraham hall back yard]1021-its back yard , so to speak , to [the Five Towns]193-the five towns . And though the carpets were rolled up and tied with strings , and though there were dark rectangular spaces on the walls showing where pictures had been , the effect of [the hall]2083-the hall was quite a furnished effect . Polished oak and tasselled hangings , and monstrous vases and couches and chairs preserved in [it]2083-the hall the appearance of [a home]1024-a home , if [a home of giants]1025-a home of giants .

Decidedly [it]2083-the hall was worthy of the mighty reputations of [the extinct Wilbrahams]135-the wilbrahams . [The Wilbrahams]135-the wilbrahams had gradually risen in [North Staffordshire]37-north staffordshire for two centuries . About [the Sunday of the Battle of [Waterloo]39-waterloo]38-the sunday of the battle of waterloo [they]1015-they were at [their]1015-they apogee . Then for a century [they]1015-they had gradually fallen . And at last [they]1015-they had extinguished [themselves]1015-they in the person of [a young - old fool who was in prison for having cheated [a pawnbroker]1027-a pawnbroker]1026-a young - old fool who was in prison for having cheated a pawnbroker . [This young - old fool]1028-this young - old fool had nothing but the name of [Wilbraham]136-wilbraham to [his]1028-this young - old fool back . The wealth of [the Wilbrahams]135-the wilbrahams , or what remained of [it]2083-the hall after eight decades of declension , had , during the course of a famous twenty years ' law - suit between [the father of [the said young - old fool]1030-the said young - old fool and [a farming cousin in [California]40-california]1031-a farming cousin in california]1029-the father of the said young - old fool and a farming cousin in california , slowly settled like golden dust in [the offices of lawyers in [Carey - street]41-carey - street , [London]4-london]1032-the offices of lawyers in carey - street , london . And [the house]475-the house , [grounds]1034-grounds , lake , and furniture save certain portraits were now on sale by order of [the distant winner of the law - suit]1035-the distant winner of the law - suit . And both [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter and [James]74-james could remember the time when the twin - horsed equipage of [the Wilbrahams]135-the wilbrahams used to dash about [the Five Towns]193-the five towns like the chariot of the sun . The recollection made [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter sad , but in [James]74-james it produced no such feeling . To [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter , [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall was [the last of [the stylish port - wine estates]1038-the stylish port - wine estates that in old days dotted [the heights around [the Five Towns]193-the five towns]1039-the heights around the five towns]1037-the last of the stylish port - wine estates that in old days dotted the heights around the five towns . To [her]84-mrs. prockter it was the symbol of the death of tone and the triumph of industrialism . Whereas [James]74-james merely saw [it]34-wilbraham hall as so much building land upon which streets of [profitable and inexpensive semi - detached villas]1041-profitable and inexpensive semi - detached villas would one day rise at the wand 's touch of [the man who had sufficient audacity for a prodigious speculation]1042-the man who had sufficient audacity for a prodigious speculation .

" It ' ud be like living in [th ' covered market]2108-th ' covered market , living [here]1785-here , "[74-james] [James]74-james observed .

[The St. Luke 's Market]42-the st. luke 's market is [the largest roof in [Bursley]1-bursley]1043-the largest roof in bursley . And [old inhabitants]1044-old inhabitants , incapable of recovering from the surprise of marketing under cover instead of in [an open square]1045-an open square , still , after thirty years , refer to [it]42-the st. luke 's market as [the covered market]1046-the covered market .

[Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter smiled .

" By the way , "[74-james] said [James]74-james , " where 's [[them]1047-the old people [childer]2111-childer]2110-them childer ? "[74-james]

" Well ? [He]106-james said nothing . [He]106-james was furious . And now , instantly after that amazing and mad generosity , [she]79-helen had the face to look cross because [he]106-james would not buy [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall ! It was inconceivable ; it was unutterable . So [he]106-james said nothing .

" Why should n't [you]106-james , after all ? "[79-helen] [she]79-helen resumed . " [You]106-james 've got an income of nearly five thousand a year . " [You]106-james do n't spend the twentieth part of it . What are [you]106-james going to do with it ? What are [you]106-james going to do with it ? " [You]106-james ca n't take it with [you]106-james when [you]106-james leave [the Five Towns]193-the five towns , [you]106-james know . Whom shall [you]106-james leave [your]106-james money to ? Because there 's [nobody else]2134-nobody else for [you]106-james to leave it to . Why ca n't [you]106-james use it now , instead of wasting it in old stockings ? "[79-helen]

" [I]1077-you bank [my]1077-you money , [wench]2135-wench , "[1077-you] [he]1077-you hissingly put in .

" Old stockings ! "[1078-she] [she]1078-she repeated , loudly . " [We]2136-we could live splendidly at [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall on two thousand a year , and [you]1077-you would still be saving nearly three thousand a year . "[1078-she]

[He]1077-you said nothing .

" Do [you]1077-you suppose [I]1078-she gave up [my]1078-she position at [school]1776-school in order to live in a poky little hole at eighteen pounds a year ? What do [you]1077-you think [I]1078-she can do with [myself]1078-she all day in [Trafalgar - road]24-trafalgar - road ? Why , nothing There 's [no room]2138-no room even for a piano , and so [my]1078-she fingers are stiffening every day . It 's not life at all . Naturally , it 's a great privilege , "[1078-she] [she]1078-she pursued , with a vicious inflection that reminded [him]1077-you perfectly of [Susan]78-susan , " for [a girl like [me]78-susan to live with [an old man like [you]1077-you]2140-an old man like you , all alone , with [one servant]2141-one servant and [no sitting - room]2142-no sitting - room]2139-a girl like me to live with an old man like you , all alone , with one servant and no sitting - room . But some privileges cost too dear . The fact is , [you]1077-you never think of [me]78-susan at all . "[78-susan] And [he]1077-you had but just given [her]1078-she six - and - twenty pounds . " [You]1077-you think [you]1077-you 've got [a cheap housekeeper in [me]1077-you]2143-a cheap housekeeper in me - but [you]1077-you have n't . [I]1077-you 'm [a very good housekeeper]2144-a very good housekeeper - especially in [a very large house]2145-a very large house - but [I]1077-you 'm not cheap . "[1077-you]

[She]1078-she spoke as if [she]1078-she had all [her]1078-she life been accustomed to living in [vast mansions]1079-vast mansions But [James]106-james knew that , despite [[her]1078-she fine friends]1080-her fine friends , [she]1078-she had never lived in anything appreciably larger than [[his]106-james own dwelling]1081-his own dwelling . [He]106-james knew there was [not a house in [Sneyd - road]15-sneyd - road]1082-not a house in sneyd - road , [Longshaw]7-longshaw , worth more than twenty - five pounds a year . The whole outbreak was shocking and disgraceful . [He]106-james scarcely recognised [her]1078-she .

[He]106-james said nothing . And then suddenly [he]106-james said : " [I]106-james shall buy no [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall , [lass]1738-lass . "[106-james] [His]106-james voice was final .

" [You]106-james could sell [it]34-wilbraham hall again at a profit , "[1078-she] said [she]1078-she . "[95-emanuel]

" Yes , "[106-james] said [he]106-james ; " [Buckingham Palace]45-buckingham palace , likely ! "[106-james]

" [I]1078-she do n't - "[1078-she] [she]1078-she began .

" [I]106-james shall buy no [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall , "[106-james] [he]106-james reiterated .

[Greek]1083-greek had met [Greek]137-greek .

[The tram]1084-the tram surged along and swallowed up [the two Greeks]1085-the two greeks . " [You]106-james 're [a miser]2149-a miser , that 's what [you]106-james , are ! [A regular old miser]2150-a regular old miser ! [Every one]924-every one knows that . " Ah ! "[1090-he] [he]1090-he snorted . It was a painful sight . [Other persons]1091-other persons boarded [the car]1092-the car .

At tea [she]1093-she behaved precisely like [an angel]1094-an angel . Not the least hint of [her]1093-she demeanour of the ineffable affray of the afternoon . [She]1093-she was so sweet that [he]1090-he might have given [her]1093-she twenty - six [Wilbraham Halls]46-wilbraham halls instead of twenty - six pounds . [He]1090-he spoke not . [He]1090-he was , in a very deep sense , upset .

[She]1093-she spent the evening in [[her]1093-she room]1095-her room .

" Good - bye , "[1093-she] [she]1093-she said the next morning , most amiably . It was after breakfast . [She]1093-she was hatted , gloved and sunshaded .

" What ? "[1090-he] [he]1090-he exclaimed .

[He]1090-he let [her]1093-she shake [his]1090-he hand .

Then [Helen]79-helen called , with the casual information that [she]79-helen was off to [Canada]11-canada . [She]79-helen was particularly sweet . [She]79-helen had the tact to make the interview short . " Good - bye . "[1101-be]

[DESCENDANTS OF MACHIAVELLI]139-descendants of machiavelli

Yes , [she]79-helen turned towards [him]1090-he with a rapid , impulsive movement , which expressed partly [her]79-helen sympathy for [[her]79-helen old uncle]1102-her old uncle , and partly a feeling of joy caused by the sudden hope that [he]1090-he had decided to give way and buy [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall after all . And the fact was that , in [his]1090-he secret soul , [he]1090-he had decided to give way ; [he]1090-he had decided that [Helen]79-helen , together with [Helen]79-helen 's cooking , was worth to [him]1090-he the price of [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall . But when [he]1090-he saw [her]79-helen brusque , eager gesture , [he]1090-he began to reflect . [His]1103-his was a wily and profound nature ; [he]1090-he reckoned that [he]1090-he could read the human soul , and [he]1090-he said to [himself]1090-he :

" [The wench]2102-the wench is n't so set on leaving [me]1090-he as [I]1090-he thought [she]79-helen was . "[1090-he]

And instead of saying to [her]79-helen : " [Helen]79-helen , [lass]1738-lass , if [you]79-helen 'll stop [you]79-helen shall have [your]79-helen [Wilbraham[1090-he]

Hall]34-wilbraham hall , " in tones of affecting , sad surrender , [he]1090-he said :[1090-he]

" [I]1090-he 'm sorry to lose [thee]79-helen , [[my]1090-he girl]2163-my girl ; but must be must . "[1090-he]

And when [he]1090-he caught the look in [her]79-helen eyes , [he]1090-he was more than ever convinced that [he]1090-he would be able to keep [Helen]79-helen without satisfying [her]79-helen extremely expensive whim .

[Helen]79-helen , for [her]79-helen part , began to suspect that if [she]79-helen played the fish with sufficient skill , [she]79-helen would capture it . Thus [they]1104-they both , in a manner of speaking , got out [their]1104-they landing - nets .

" [I]74-james do n't say , "[74-james] [James Ollerenshaw]74-james proceeded , in accents calculated to prove to [her]79-helen that [he]1090-he had just as great a horror of sentimentality as [she]79-helen had - " [I]1090-he do n't say as [you]79-helen would n't make [a rare good mistress o ' [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall]2164-a rare good mistress o ' wilbraham hall . " [Uncle]2167-uncle ! "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen protested .

"[1105-he]

" [You]1105-he 'll live many and many a year yet , "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen smiled .

[He]1105-he considered that [he]1105-he was gradually winding in [his]1105-he line with immense skill . " Ay , "[1105-he] [he]1105-he ejaculated , with an absent air , " it 's a fancy o ' mine . "[1105-he]

" No , "[1105-he] [he]1105-he replied .

The next development was that , without another word , [she]79-helen removed [her]79-helen gloves , lifted [her]79-helen pale hands to [her]79-helen head , and slowly drew hatpins from [her]79-helen hat . Then [she]79-helen removed [her]79-helen hat , and plunged the pins into it again . [He]1105-he could scarcely refrain from snatching off [his]1105-he own tasselled Turkish cap and pitching it in the air . [He]1105-he felt as if [he]1105-he had won the Battle of [Hastings]47-hastings , or defeated [the captain of the bowling club]413-the captain of the bowling club in a single - handed match .

" And to think , "[1105-he] [he]1105-he reflected , " that [I]1105-he should ha ' given in to [her]79-helen by this time if [I]1105-he had n't got more sense in [my]1105-he little finger than - "[1105-he] etc .

[He]74-james was gay . [He]74-james could not conceal [his]74-james gaiety . [He]74-james saw [himself]74-james freed from the menace of the thraldom of [Mrs. Butt]97-mrs. butt . [He]74-james saw [himself]74-james gourmandising over the meals that [Helen]79-helen alone could cook . [He]74-james saw [himself]74-james trotting up and down [the streets of [Bursley]1-bursley]1107-the streets of bursley with [the finest , smartest lass in [the Five Towns]193-the five towns]1108-the finest , smartest lass in the five towns by [his]74-james side . And scarcely a penny of extra expenditure ! And all this happy issue due to [his]74-james diplomatic and histrionic skill ! The fact was , [Helen]79-helen really liked [him]74-james . There could be no doubt about that [She]79-helen liked [him]74-james , and [she]79-helen would not leave [him]74-james Also , [she]79-helen was [a young woman of exceptional common sense]1110-a young woman of exceptional common sense , and , being such , [she]79-helen would not risk the loss of a large fortune merely for the sake of indulging pique engendered by [his]74-james refusal to gratify a ridiculous caprice .

Before [she]79-helen had well quitted [the room]499-the room [he]74-james saw with clearness that [he]74-james was quite [the astutest man in [the world]220-the world]1112-the astutest man in the world , and that [Helen]79-helen was clay in [his]74-james hands .

The sound of crockery in [the scullery]491-the scullery , and the cheerful little explosion when the gas - ring was ignited , and the low mutter of conversation that ensued between [Helen]79-helen and [Georgiana]119-georgiana - these phenomena were music to [the artist in [him]74-james]1115-the artist in him . [He]74-james extracted the concertina from its case and began to play " The Dead March in [Saul]48-saul . "[74-james] Not because [his]74-james sentiments had a foundation in the slightest degree funereal , but because [he]74-james could perform " The Dead March in [Saul]48-saul "[74-james] with more virtuosity than any other piece except " The Hallelujah Chorus . "[74-james] And [he]74-james did not desire to insist too much on [his]74-james victory by filling [Trafalgar]24-trafalgar - road - road with " The Hallelujah Chorus "[74-james] . [He]74-james was discretion [itself]74-james .

When [she]79-helen came back to [the parlour]1116-the parlour astoundingly natty in a muslin apron of [Georgiana]119-georgiana 's to announce supper , [she]79-helen made no reference to the concert which [she]79-helen was interrupting . [He]74-james abandoned the concertina gently , caressing it into its leather shell . [He]74-james was full to the brim with kindliness . It seemed to [him]74-james that [his]74-james life with [Helen]79-helen was commencing all over again . Then [he]74-james followed the indications of [his]74-james nose , which already for some minutes had been prophesying to [him]74-james that in the concoction of the supper [Helen]79-helen had surpassed [herself]79-helen .

And [she]79-helen had . There was kidney No , not in an omelette , but impaled on a skewer . A novel species of kidney , a particularity in kidneys !

" Where didst pick this up , [lass]1738-lass ? "[74-james] [he]74-james asked .

" It 's the kidneys of that rabbit that [you]74-james 've bought for to - morrow , "[79-helen] said [she]79-helen .

Now , [he]74-james had no affection for rabbit as an article of diet , and [he]74-james had only bought the rabbit because the rabbit happened to be going past [his]74-james door in the hands of [a hawker]1117-a hawker that morning . [His]74-james perfunctory purchase of it showed how [he]74-james had lost interest in life and meals since [Helen]79-helen 's departure . And lo ! [she]79-helen had transformed a minor part of it into something wondrous , luscious , and unforgettab1e . Ah , [she]79-helen was [Helen]79-helen ! And [she]79-helen was [his]74-james !

" [I]79-helen 've asked [Georgiana]119-georgiana to make up [my]79-helen bed , "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen said , after the divine repast .

" [I]74-james 'll tell [ye]119-georgiana what [I]74-james 'll do , "[74-james] [he]74-james said , in an ecstasy of generosity , " [I]74-james 'll buy [thee]119-georgiana a piano , [lass]1738-lass , and [we]2182-we 'll put it in [th ' parlour]2183-th ' parlour against the wall where them books are now . "[74-james]

[She]79-helen kept silence - a silence which vaguely disturbed [him]74-james .

So that [he]74-james added : " And if [ye're]119-georgiana bent on [a bigger house]2184-a bigger house , there 's one up at [Park - road]49-park - road , above [th ' Park]2185-th ' park , semi - detached - at least , [it]2186-it 's the end of [a terrace]2187-a terrace - as [I]74-james can get for thirty pounds a year . "[74-james]

" [[My]79-helen dearest uncle]2188-my dearest uncle , "[79-helen] [she]79-helen said , in a firm , even voice , " what are [you]74-james talking about ? Did n't [I]79-helen tell [you]74-james when [I]79-helen came in that [I]79-helen had settled to go to [Canada]11-canada ? [I]79-helen thought it was all decided . Surely [you]74-james do n't think [I]79-helen 'm going to live in [a poky house in [Park - road]49-park - road]2189-a poky house in park - road - [the very street where [[my]79-helen school]2191-my school was , too]2190-the very street where my school was , too ! [I]79-helen perfectly understand that [you]74-james wo n't buy [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall . That 's all right . [I]79-helen sha n't pout . [I]79-helen hate [women who pout]2192-women who pout . [We]2193-we ca n't agree , but [we]2193-we 're [friends]2194-friends . [You]74-james do what [you]74-james like with [your]74-james money , and [I]79-helen do what [I]79-helen like with [myself]79-helen . [I]79-helen had a sort of idea [I]79-helen would try to make [you]74-james beautifully comfortable just for the last time before [I]79-helen left [England]5-england , and that 's why [I]79-helen 'm staying . [I]79-helen do hope [you]1119-he did n't imagine anything else , [uncle]1867-uncle . There ! "[79-helen]

[She]1118-she kissed [him]1119-he , not as [a niece]1120-a niece , but as [a wise , experienced nurse]1121-a wise , experienced nurse might have kissed [a little boy]1122-a little boy . For [she]1118-she too , in [her]1118-she way , reckoned [herself]1118-she somewhat of [a diplomatist]1123-a diplomatist and [a descendant of [Machiavelli]139-descendants of machiavelli]1124-a descendant of machiavelli . [She]1118-she had thought : " It 's a funny thing if [I]1118-she ca n't bring [him]1119-he to [his]1119-he knees with a tasty supper - just to make it clear to [him]1119-he what [he]1119-he 'll lose if [he]1119-he loses [me]1118-she . "[1118-she]

[James Ollerenshaw]74-james had no sleep that night . And [Helen]79-helen had but little .

Contents Chapter 18

CHICANE

[He]1119-he came [downstairs]422-downstairs early , as [he]1119-he had done after a previous sleepless night - also caused by [Helen]79-helen .

That it would be foolish , fatuous , and inexcusable to persevere further in [his]1119-he obstinacy against [Helen]79-helen , this [he]1119-he knew . [He]1119-he saw clearly that all [his]1119-he arguments to [her]79-helen about money and the saving of money were ridiculous ; they would not have carried conviction even to the most passive intelligence , and [Helen]79-helen 's intelligence was far from passive . They were not even true in fact , for [he]1119-he had never intended to leave any money to [[Helen]79-helen 's mother]1126-helen 's mother ; [he]1119-he had never intended to leave any money to [anybody]517-anybody , simply because [he]1119-he had not cared to think of [his]1119-he own decease ; [he]1119-he had made no plans about the valuable fortune which , as [Helen]79-helen had too forcibly told [him]1119-he , [he]1119-he would not be able to bear away with [him]1119-he when [he]1119-he left [Bursley]1-bursley for ever ; this subject was not pleasant to [him]1119-he . All [his]1119-he rambling sentences to [Helen]79-helen which [he]1119-he had thought so clever when [he]1119-he uttered them were merely an excuse for not parting with money - money that was useless to [him]1119-he .

On the other hand , what [Helen]79-helen had said was both true and convincing ; at any rate , it convinced [him]1119-he .

[He]1119-he was [a miser]2149-a miser ; [he]1119-he admitted it . Being [a miser]2149-a miser , [he]1119-he saw , was one way of enjoying [yourself]1130-yourself , but not the best way . Again , if [he]1119-he really desired to enrich [Helen]79-helen , how much better to enrich [her]79-helen at once than at an uncertain date when [he]1119-he would be dead . [Dead people]1131-dead people ca n't be thanked . [Dead people]1131-dead people ca n't be kissed . [Dead people]1131-dead people ca n't have [curious dainties]1134-curious dainties offered to [them]1131-dead people for [their]1131-dead people supper . [He]1119-he wished to keep [Helen]79-helen ; but [Helen]79-helen would only stay on one condition . That condition was a perfectly easy condition for [him]1119-he to fulfil . After paying eight thousand pounds or a bit less for [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall , [he]1119-he would still have about ten times as much money as [he]1119-he could possibly require . Of course , eight thousand pounds was a lot of coin . But , then , [you]1130-yourself ca n't measure [women]329-women especially when [they]329-women are good cooks in terms of coin . For instance , it happened that [he]1119-he had exactly L8,000 in shares of [the London and North Western Railway Company]1136-the london and north western railway company . The share - certificates were in [his]1119-he safe ; [he]1119-he could hold them in [his]1119-he hand ; [he]1119-he could sell them and buy [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall with the proceeds . That is to say , [he]1119-he could exchange them for [Helen]79-helen . Now , it would be preposterous to argue that [he]1119-he would not derive more satisfaction from [Helen]79-helen than from those crackling share - certificates .

[Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall , once [he]1119-he became [its owner]1137-its owner , would be a worry - an awful worry . Well , would it ? Would not [Helen]79-helen be entirely capable of looking after it , of superintending it in every way ? [He]1119-he knew that [she]79-helen would ! As for the upkeep of existence in [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall , had not [Helen]79-helen proved to [him]1119-he that its cost was insignificant when compared to [his]1119-he income ? [She]79-helen had .

And as to [his]1119-he own daily manner of living , could [he]1119-he not live precisely as [he]1119-he chose at [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall ? [He]1119-he could . It was vast ; but nothing would compel [him]1119-he to live in all of [it]34-wilbraham hall at once . [He]1119-he could choose [a nice little room]1138-a nice little room , and put a notice on the door that it was not to be disturbed . And [Helen]79-helen could run the rest of [the mansion]1139-the mansion as [her]79-helen caprice dictated .

The process of argument was over when [Helen]79-helen descended to put the finishing touches to a breakfast which [she]79-helen had evidently concocted with [Georgiana]119-georgiana the night before .

" Breakfast is ready , [uncle]1867-uncle , "[79-helen] [she]79-helen called to [him]1119-he .

[He]1119-he obeyed . Flowers on the table once more ! The first since [her]79-helen departure ! A clean cloth ! A general , inexplicable tuning - up of the meal 's frame .

[You]1140-you would now , perhaps , have expected [him]1119-he to yield , as gracefully as [an old man]348-an old man can . [He]1119-he wanted to yield . [He]1119-he hungered to yield . [He]1119-he knew that it was utterly for [his]1119-he own good to yield .

But if [you]1140-you seriously expected [him]1119-he to yield , [your]1140-you knowledge of human nature lacks depth . Something far stronger than argument , something far stronger than desire for [his]1119-he own happiness , prevented [him]1119-he from yielding . [Pride]140-pride , [a silly self - conceit]1142-a silly self - conceit , [the greatest enemy of [the human race]1144-the human race]1143-the greatest enemy of the human race , forbade [him]1119-he to yield . For , on the previous night , [Helen]79-helen had snubbed [him]1119-he - and not for the first time . [He]1119-he could not accept the snub with meekness , though it would have paid [him]1119-he handsomely to do so , though as [a Christian]1145-a christian and [a philosopher]1146-a philosopher [he]1119-he ought to have done so . [He]1119-he could not .

So [he]1119-he put on a brave face , pretended to accept the situation with contented calm , and talked as if [Canada]11-canada was [the next street]1147-the next street , and as if [her]79-helen going was entirely indifferent to [him]1119-he . [Helen]79-helen imitated [him]1119-he .

It was a lovely morning ; not a cloud in the sky - only in [their]1148-their hearts .

" [Uncle]1867-uncle ! "[79-helen] [she]79-helen said after breakfast was done and cleared away .

[He]1119-he was counting rents in [his]1119-he cashbox in [the front parlour]1149-the front parlour , and [she]79-helen had come to [him]1119-he , and was leaning over [his]1119-he shoulder .

" Well , [lass]1738-lass ? "[79-helen]

" Have [you]1119-he got twenty - five pounds in that box ? "[1119-he]

It was obvious that [he]1119-he had .

" [I]1119-he shouldna ' be surprised , "[1119-he] said [he]1119-he .

" [I]79-helen wish [you]79-helen 'd lend it [me]79-helen . "[79-helen]

Now here was a chance to yield . But no .

[Her]1150-she fingers were already in the cashbox . [She]1150-she was behaving just like [a little girl]1151-a little girl , like [a spoilt child]1152-a spoilt child . [She]1150-she went off with four five - pound notes and five sovereigns . " Will [you]1119-he ask [me]1150-she to come back and cook the dinner ? "[1150-she] [she]1150-she smiled , ironically , enchantingly .

" Ay ! "[1119-he] [he]1119-he said . [He]1119-he was bound to smile also .

[She]1150-she returned in something over two hours .

It was the ticket for [the steamer]1153-the steamer . This staggered [him]1119-he . [She]1150-she had settled every detail .

This idea of accompanying [her]1150-she to [Glasgow]17-glasgow pleased [him]1119-he intensely . "[1119-he]

Thus , on the Friday morning , [he]1119-he met [her]1150-she down at [Shawport Station]53-shawport station . [He]1119-he was in [his]1119-he best clothes , but [he]1119-he had walked . " Never had any , "[1119-he] [he]1119-he said .

[The train]2205-the train was prompt , but between [Shawport]52-shawport and [Crewe]51-crewe [it]2205-the train suffered delays , so that there was not an inordinate amount of time to spare at [the majestic junction]1173-the majestic junction .

[Heedless , fly - away creature that [she]79-helen was]1174-heedless , fly - away creature that she was , [Helen]79-helen scurried from [the North Stafford platform]1175-the north stafford platform to [the main - line platform]1176-the main - line platform without a thought as to [her]79-helen luggage . [She]79-helen was apparently so preoccupied with [her]79-helen handbag , which contained [her]79-helen purse , that [she]79-helen had no anxiety left over for [her]79-helen heavy belongings .

As [they]1177-they hastened forward , [he]1119-he saw the luggage being tumbled out on to [the platform]1165-the platform .

[The Glasgow tram]1179-the glasgow tram rolled grandiosely in , and [the restaurant - car]1180-the restaurant - car came to a standstill almost exactly opposite the end of [the North Stafford platform]1175-the north stafford platform . [They]1177-they obtained two seats with difficultly . Then , as there was five minutes to wait , [Jimmy]74-james descended from [the car]1092-the car to the asphalt and peeped down [the North Stafford platform]1175-the north stafford platform . Yes , [her]79-helen luggage was lying there , deserted , in a pile . [He]1119-he regained [the carriage]1184-the carriage .

" [I]79-helen suppose the luggage will be all right ? "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen said , calmly , just as [the guard]1185-the guard whistled .

" Ay ! "[1119-he] said [he]1119-he , with the mien of [a traveller , of vast experience]1186-a traveller , of vast experience . " [I]1119-he saw ['em]2212-'em bringing all th ' N.S. luggage over . It were [th]2212-'em ' fust thing [I]1119-he thought of . "[1119-he]

As [a liar]1187-a liar [he]1119-he reckoned [he]1119-he was pretty good . [He]1119-he felt safe . [He]1119-he felt strangely joyous . [He]1119-he ate largely , and made very dry , humorous remarks about the novelty of [a restaurant on wheels]1191-a restaurant on wheels .

" Bless [us]2213-us ! "[1119-he] [he]1119-he said , as [the express]1192-the express flashed through [Preston]54-preston without stopping . " It 's fust time as [I]1119-he 've begun a bottle o ' Bass in [one town]2214-one town and finished it in another . "[1119-he]

[He]1119-he grew positively jolly , and the journey seemed to be accomplished with the rapidity of a dream .

Contents Chapter 19

THE TOSSING

" [You]1119-he said [you]1119-he 'd seen it into [the van]2215-the van , "[79-helen] pouted [Helen]79-helen - [she]79-helen who never pouted !

" Nay , [lass]1738-lass , "[1119-he] [he]1119-he corrected [her]79-helen , " [I]1119-he said [I]1119-he 'd seen ['em]2217-'em bringing all th ' luggage over . "[1119-he]

The inevitable moment of reckoning had arrived . [They]1193-they stood together on [the platform of [St. Enoch 's]55-st. enoch 's , [Glasgow]17-glasgow]1194-the platform of st. enoch 's , glasgow . The last pieces of luggage were being removed from [[the guard]1185-the guard 's van]1196-the guard 's van under the direction of [passengers]1197-passengers , and there was no sign whatever of [Helen]79-helen 's trunks . This absence of [Helen]79-helen 's trunks did not in the least surprise [James Ollerenshaw]74-james ; [he]74-james was perfectly aware that [Helen]79-helen 's trunks reposed , at that selfsame instant , in [the lost luggage office at [Crewe]51-crewe]1198-the lost luggage office at crewe ; but , of course , [he]74-james had to act surprise . In case of necessity [he]74-james could act very well . It was more difficult for [him]74-james to act sorrow than to act surprise ; but [he]74-james did both to [his]74-james own satisfaction . [He]74-james climbed into [the van]2215-the van and scanned [its]2215-the van corners - in vain . Then , side by side , [they]1200-they visited [the other van at the head of [the train]2205-the train]1201-the other van at the head of the train , with an equal result .

[The two guards]1203-the two guards , being [Scotch]141-scotch , responded to inquiries with extreme caution . All that [they]1200-they would answer for was that the trunks were not in [the train]2205-the train . Then [the train]2205-the train was drawn out of [the station]1206-the station by a toy - engine , and [the express engine]1207-the express engine followed [it]2205-the train with grave dignity , and [Helen]79-helen and [Jimmy]74-james were left staring at the empty rails .

" Something must be done , "[79-helen] said [Helen]79-helen , crossly . " Ay ! "[74-james] [Jimmy]74-james agreed . " It 's long past [my]74-james tea - time . [We]2218-we must find out if there 's anything to eat [i]74-james ' [Scotland]6-scotland . "[74-james]

But [Helen]79-helen insisted on visiting [the station]1206-the station - master . Such errors did occur sometimes , [he]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's said , implying that [the North Western]1215-the north western was an English railway , and that surprising things happened in [England]5-england . [He]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's said , also , that [Helen]79-helen might telephone to [Edinburgh]57-edinburgh and inquire .

[She]79-helen endeavoured to act on this counsel , but came out of [the telephone cabin]1216-the telephone cabin saying that [she]79-helen could not get into communication with [Edinburgh]57-edinburgh .

" Better go over to [Edinburgh]57-edinburgh and see for [yourself]79-helen , "[74-james] said [Jimmy]74-james , tranquilly .

" Yes , and what about [[my]79-helen steamer]2219-my steamer ? "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen turned on [him]74-james .

" [Scotland]6-scotland canna ' be so big as all that , "[74-james] said [Jimmy]74-james . " Not according to th ' maps . [Us]1217-us could run over to [Edinburgh]57-edinburgh to - night , and get back to [Glasgow]17-glasgow early to - morrow . "[74-james]

[She]79-helen consented .

Just as [he]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's was taking two second returns to [Edinburgh]57-edinburgh [they]1217-us had snatched railway eggs and railway tea while waiting for [a fast train]1218-a fast train [he]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's stopped and said :

" Unless [ye]79-helen prefer to sail without [your]79-helen trunks , and [I]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's could send ['em]2220-'em on by [th ' next steamer]2221-th ' next steamer ? "[1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's]

"[1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's]

In the [Edinburgh]57-edinburgh train [he]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's could scarcely refrain from laughing . And [Helen]79-helen , too , seemed more in a humour to accept the disappearance of five invaluable trunks , full of preciosities , as [a facetious sally on the part of destiny]1219-a facetious sally on the part of destiny .

[He]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's drew out a note - book which [he]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's always carried , and did mathematical calculations .

" That makes ' twenty - seven pounds eighteen and ninepence as [ye]79-helen owe [me]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's , "[1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's] [he]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's remarked .

" What ? For railway tickets ? "[1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's]

" Railway tickets , tips , and that twenty - five pounds [I]79-helen lent [ye]79-helen . [I]79-helen 'm making [ye]79-helen a present o ' [my]79-helen fares , and dinner , and tea and so forth . "[79-helen]

" Twenty - five pounds that [you]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's lent [me]79-helen ! "[79-helen] [she]79-helen murmured .

" Yes , "[1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's] [he]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's said " Tuesday morning , while [I]79-helen was at [my]79-helen cashbox . "[79-helen]

" Oh , that ! "[79-helen] [she]79-helen ejaculated . " [I]79-helen thought [you]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's were giving [me]79-helen that . [I]79-helen never thought [you]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's 'd ask [me]79-helen for it again , [uncle]1867-uncle . [I]79-helen 'd completely forgotten all about it . "[79-helen] -

[She]79-helen seemed quite sincere in this amazing assertion .

[His]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's acquaintance with the ways of [women]329-women was thus enlarged , suddenly , and at the merely nominal expense of twenty - five pounds . It was a wondrous proof of [his]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's high spirits and [his]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's general contentedness with [himself]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's that [he]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's should have submitted to the robbery without a groan .

" What 's twenty - five pun ' ? "[1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's] [he]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's reflected . " There 'll be no luggage for [her]79-helen at [Edinburgh]57-edinburgh ; [that steamer'll]2225-that steamer'll go without [her]79-helen ; and then [I]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's shall give in . [I]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's shall save [my]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's face , anyhow . "[1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's]

And [he]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's further decided that , in case of necessity , in case of [Helen]79-helen at a later stage pushing [her]79-helen inquiries as to the luggage inconveniently far [he]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's would have to bribe [the porter at [Shawport]52-shawport]1221-the porter at shawport to admit to [her]79-helen that [he]1209-the stationmaster at st. enoch 's , [the porter]1166-the porter , had made a mistake in the labelling .

When [they]1223-they had satisfied [themselves]1223-they that [Edinburgh]57-edinburgh did not contain [Helen]79-helen 's trunks - no mean labour , for [the lost luggage office]1224-the lost luggage office was closed , and [they]1223-they had to move mountains in order to get it opened on the plea of extremest urgency - [Jimmy Ollerenshaw]74-james turned to [[Susan]78-susan 's daughter]1225-susan 's daughter , saying to [himself]74-james that [she]1225-susan 's daughter must be soothed regardless of cost . [Miracles]143-miracles would not enable [her]1225-susan 's daughter to catch [the steamer]1153-the steamer now , and the hour was fast approaching when [he]74-james would benevolently offer [her]1225-susan 's daughter the gift of [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall .

" Well , [lass]1738-lass , "[74-james] [he]74-james began , " [I]74-james 'm right sorry . What 's to be done ? "[74-james]

" There 's nothing at all to be done , "[1225-susan 's daughter] [she]1225-susan 's daughter replied , smiling sadly . [She]1225-susan 's daughter might have upbraided [him]74-james for carelessness in the matter of the luggage . [She]1225-susan 's daughter might have burst into tears and declared passionately that it was all [his]74-james fault . But [she]1225-susan 's daughter did not . "[1225-susan 's daughter]

" That 'll do to - morrow , "[74-james] [he]74-james said . " What 's to be done to - night ? In th ' way o ' supper , as [ye]74-james might say ? "[74-james]

" [We]2228-we must go to [an hotel]1158-an hotel . [I]1225-susan 's daughter believe [the station hotel]2230-the station hotel is the best . "[1225-susan 's daughter] [She]1225-susan 's daughter pointed to a sign and a directing black hand which said : " To [the hotel]2231-the hotel . "[1225-susan 's daughter]

In a minute [James Ollerenshaw]74-james found [himself]74-james in [the largest and most gorgeous hotel in [Scotland]6-scotland]1227-the largest and most gorgeous hotel in scotland .

" Look here , [wench]2135-wench , "[74-james] [he]74-james said . " [I]74-james do n't know as this is much in [my]74-james line . Summat a thought less gaudy'll do for [my]74-james old bones . "[74-james]

" [I]79-helen wo n't move a step farther this night ! "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen declared . " [I]79-helen 'm ready to drop . "[79-helen]

[He]74-james remembered that [she]79-helen must be soothed .

" Well , "[74-james] [he]74-james said , " here goes ! "[74-james]

" Well , [[my]74-james girl]2163-my girl , "[74-james] [he]74-james said , " cheer up . If [ye]2163-my girl tak ' [my]74-james advice ye'll make up [yer]2163-my girl mind to stop [i]74-james ' owd [England]5-england with [[yer]2163-my girl owd uncle]2243-yer owd uncle . "[74-james]

[She]79-helen nodded .
