Contents Chapter 20

THE FLITTING

Before [the spacious crimson façade of [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall]1252-the spacious crimson façade of wilbraham hall upon an autumn day stood [Mr. Crump]146-mr. crump 's pantechnicon . That is to say , it was a pantechnicon only by courtesy - [Mr. Crump]146-mr. crump 's courtesy . In strict adherence to truth it was just [a common furniture - removing van , dragged over [the earth]1071-the earth 's surface by two horses]1253-a common furniture - removing van , dragged over the earth 's surface by two horses . On the outer walls of [it]1253-a common furniture - removing van , dragged over the earth 's surface by two horses were an announcement that [Mr. Crump]146-mr. crump removed goods by road , rail or [steamer]1255-steamer , and vast coloured pictures of [Mr. Crump]146-mr. crump removing goods by [road]1256-road , rail and [steamer]1255-steamer . [One]371-one saw [the van]2215-the van in situations of grave danger - travelling on [an express train]1260-an express train over [a lofty viaduct]1261-a lofty viaduct at sixty miles an hour , or rolling on the deck of [a steamer]755-a steamer in [a stormy sea]496-a stormy sea . [One]371-one saw it also in situations of impressive natural beauty - as , for instance , passing by [road]1256-road through [terrific mountain defiles]1266-terrific mountain defiles , where cataracts rushed and foamed . The historic fact was that [the van]2215-the van had never been beyond [the Five Towns]193-the five towns . Nevertheless , [Mr. Crump]146-mr. crump bound [himself]146-mr. crump in painted letters six inches high to furnish estimates for any removal whatsoever and , what is more , as a special boon to [the Five Towns]193-the five towns , to furnish estimates free of charge . In this detail [Mr. Crump]146-mr. crump had determined not to lag behind [[his]146-mr. crump fellow - furniture - removers , who , one and all , persist in refusing to accept even a small fee for telling [you]1271-you how much [they]1270-his fellow - furniture - removers , who , one and all , persist in refusing to accept even a small fee for telling you how much they demand for their services demand for [their]1270-his fellow - furniture - removers , who , one and all , persist in refusing to accept even a small fee for telling you how much they demand for their services services]1270-his fellow - furniture - removers , who , one and all , persist in refusing to accept even a small fee for telling you how much they demand for their services .

In [the van]2215-the van were the entire worldly possessions of [James Ollerenshaw]74-james except [[his]74-james houses]1273-his houses , [his]74-james investments , a set of bowls up at [the bowling club]414-the bowling club , and the clothes [he]74-james wore , and the entire worldly possessions of [Helen Rathbone]79-helen except the clothes [she]79-helen wore . If it be asked where was the twenty - six pounds so generously given to [her]79-helen by [a loving uncle]1275-a loving uncle , the reply is that the whole sum , together with much else , was in the coffers of [Ezra Brunt]111-brunt , [the draper]1276-the draper and costumier at [Hanbridge]25-hanbridge ; and the reply further is that [Helen]79-helen was in debt . [I]0-i have hitherto concealed [Helen]79-helen 's tendency to debts , but it was bound sooner or later to come out . And here it is .

After an adventurous journey by bridge over [the North Staffordshire Railway]1277-the north staffordshire railway , and by bridge over [the Shropshire Union Canal]1278-the shropshire union canal , and by bridge over [the foaming cataract of [the Shaws Brook]59-the shaws brook]1279-the foaming cataract of the shaws brook , and down the fearful slants of [Oldcastle - street]61-oldcastle - road , and through the arduous terrific defiles of [Oldcastle - road]61-oldcastle - road , [the van]2215-the van had arrived at the portals of [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall . It would have been easy , by opening wide the portals , to have introduced [the van]2215-the van and the horses too into [the hall of [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall]1282-the hall of wilbraham hall . But this course was not adopted .

[Helen]79-helen and [Georgiana]119-georgiana had preceded [the van]2215-the van , and [they]1284-they both stood at the door to receive the goods . [Georgiana]119-georgiana was in one of [Georgiana]119-georgiana 's aprons , and [Helen]79-helen also was in one of [Georgiana]119-georgiana 's aprons . [Uncle James]106-james had followed [the van]2215-the van . [He]106-james had not let it out of [his]106-james sight . [The old man]372-the old man 's attachment to even the least of [his]372-the old man goods was touching , and [his]372-the old man attachment to the greatest of [his]372-the old man goods carried pathos into farce . The greatest of [his]372-the old man goods was , apparently , the full - rigged ship and tempestuous ocean in a glass box which had stood on the table in [the front room of [the other house]1288-the other house]1287-the front room of the other house for many years . [No one]1076-no one had suspected [his]372-the old man esteem for that glass box and its contents . [He]372-the old man had not suspected it [himself]372-the old man until the moment for packing it had come . But [he]372-the old man seemed to love it more than [his]372-the old man bits of Spode china or [his]372-the old man concertina ; and , taking it with [him]372-the old man , [he]372-the old man had quitted with a softened regret the quantity of over - blown blue roses which , in their eternal bloom , had enlivened [his]372-the old man existence during a longer period even than [the ship]1290-the ship and [ocean]1291-ocean .

[The ship]1290-the ship and ocean was the last thing put into [the van]2215-the van and the first thing taken out , and [James Ollerenshaw]74-james introduced the affair , hugged against [his]74-james own breast , into [the house of [[his]74-james descendants]1295-his descendants]1294-the house of his descendants . The remainder of the work of transference was relatively unimportant . [Two men]1296-two men accomplished it easily while the horses ate a late dinner . And then the horses and [the van]2215-the van and [the men]1298-the men went off , and there was nothing left but a few wisps of straw and so forth , on the magnificent sweep of gravel , to indicate that [they]1296-two men had ever been [there]252-there . And [Uncle James]106-james , and [Helen]79-helen , and [Georgiana]119-georgiana felt rather forlorn and abandoned . [They]1296-two men stood in [the hall]2083-the hall and looked at [each other]456-each other a little blankly , like gipsies camping out in [an abandoned cathedral]1302-an abandoned cathedral . An immense fire was burning in the immense fireplace of [the hall]2083-the hall , and similar fires were burning in [the state bedroom]1304-the state bedroom , in [a little drawing - room beyond [the main drawing - room]1306-the main drawing - room]1305-a little drawing - room beyond the main drawing - room , in [another bedroom]1307-another bedroom , in [[the giant]1308-the giant 's kitchen]1309-the giant 's kitchen , and in [one of [the attics]1062-the attics]1310-one of the attics . These fires and a certain amount of cleaning were the only preparations which [Helen]79-helen had permitted [herself]79-helen to make . Even the expense of the coal had startled [James]106-james , and [she]79-helen proposed to get [him]106-james safely in the cage before commencing the serious business which would shatter all [his]106-james nerves By a miracle of charm and audacity [she]79-helen had obtained from [him]106-james the control of a sum of seven hundred and fifty pounds . This sum , now lying nominally to [her]79-helen credit at one of [[James]106-james 's various banks]1312-james 's various banks , represented the difference between eight thousand pounds at which [James]106-james had said [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall would be cheap and seven thousand two hundred and fifty pounds at which [James]106-james had succeeded in buying [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall .

To the left of [the hall]2083-the hall , near the entrance , was quite [a small room]1314-a small room originally , perhaps , [[a butler]1315-a butler 's lair]1316-a butler 's lair , and [James]106-james was obstinate in selecting [this room]1845-this room as [[his]106-james office]1318-his office . [He]106-james had [his]106-james desk carried [there]252-there , and everything that personally affected [him]106-james except [his]106-james safe and the simple necessaries of [[his]106-james bedroom]1320-his bedroom . These were taken , not to [the state bedroom]1304-the state bedroom , which [he]106-james had declined , after insincere pressure from [Helen]79-helen to accept [it]1304-the state bedroom , but to [a much smaller sleeping - chamber]1322-a much smaller sleeping - chamber . [The numerous family of Windsor chairs]1323-the numerous family of windsor chairs , together with [other ancient honesties]1324-other ancient honesties , were sent up to [attics]1325-attics - too old at forty ! [Georgiana]119-georgiana was established in [a glorious attic]1326-a glorious attic ; [the state bedroom]1304-the state bedroom was strewn with [Helen]79-helen 's gear ; and scarcely anything remained unniched in [the Hall]2083-the hall save [the ship]1290-the ship and [ocean]1291-ocean . [They]1331-they all rested from [their]1331-they labours , and [Helen]79-helen was moved by one of [her]79-helen happiest inspirations .

" [Georgiana]119-georgiana , "[79-helen] [she]79-helen said , " go and make some tea . Bring a cup for [yourself]119-georgiana . "[79-helen]

" Yes , [miss]1793-miss . Thank [you]1793-miss , [miss]1793-miss . "[79-helen]

On removal days miserable distinctions of class are invariably lost in the large - heartedness of mutual endeavour .

It was while [the trio]1332-the trio were thus drinking tea together , standing , and , as it were , with loins still girt after the pilgrimage , that [the first visitor to [the new owners of [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall]1334-the new owners of wilbraham hall]1333-the first visitor to the new owners of wilbraham hall rang [its]34-wilbraham hall great bell and involved [Georgiana]119-georgiana in [her]119-georgiana first ceremonial duty . [Georgiana]119-georgiana was quite nervous as [she]119-georgiana went to the door .

[The caller]1335-the caller was [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel .

" [Mother]89-mother thought [I]95-emanuel might perhaps be able to help [you]119-georgiana , "[95-emanuel] said [he]95-emanuel , in the slightly simpering tone which [he]95-emanuel adopted in delicate situations , and which [he]95-emanuel thought suited [him]95-emanuel . What made the situation delicate , to [him]95-emanuel , was [Helen]79-helen 's apron - quite agreeable though the apron was . [He]95-emanuel felt , with [his]95-emanuel unerring perceptiveness , that [young ladies]1336-young ladies do not care to receive [young gentlemen]1337-young gentlemen in the apron of [a Georgiana]1338-a georgiana . [His]95-emanuel own attire was , as usual , fabulously correct ; the salient features of it being a pair of light yellow chamois gloves , loose - fitting and unbuttoned , with the gauntlets negligently turned back . These gloves were [his]95-emanuel method of expressing the fact that the visit was a visit of usefulness and not a kid - glove visit . But [Helen]79-helen seemed quite composed behind [Georgiana]119-georgiana 's apron .

" Yes , "[95-emanuel] [he]95-emanuel repeated , with smiling inanity , after [he]95-emanuel had shaken hands . " [Mother]89-mother thought [I]95-emanuel might help [you]119-georgiana . "[95-emanuel]

" What [a fool]1982-a fool [that woman]2254-that woman is ! "[106-james] reflected [James]106-james . " And what [a fool]1982-a fool [he]95-emanuel is to put it on to [[his]95-emanuel mother]2256-his mother instead of keeping it to [himself]95-emanuel ! "[106-james]

" And what did [you]95-emanuel think , [Mr. Prockter]95-emanuel ? "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen demanded . " Another cup and saucer , [Georgiana]119-georgiana . "[79-helen]

[Helen]79-helen 's question was one of [her]79-helen insolent questions .

" Perhaps [[his]95-emanuel mother]2256-his mother ai n't such [a fool]1982-a fool ! "[106-james] reflected [James]106-james . And [he]106-james perceived , or imagined [he]106-james perceived , that [their]1339-their fears of [Helen]79-helen marrying [Emanuel]95-emanuel were absurd .

[Emanuel]95-emanuel sniffed humour in the air . [He]95-emanuel never understood humour ; but [he]95-emanuel was , at any rate , sufficiently gifted with the wisdom of the simple to smile vaguely and amiably when [he]95-emanuel sniffed humour .

And then [Helen]79-helen said , with cordial kindliness :

" It 's awfully good of [you]95-emanuel - awfully good of [you]95-emanuel . Here [we]1339-their are , [you]95-emanuel see ! "[79-helen]

And the degree of cordiality was such that the fear of [her]79-helen marrying [Emanuel]95-emanuel suddenly seemed less absurd to [James]106-james . The truth was that [James]106-james never had a moment 's peace of mind with [Helen]79-helen . [She]79-helen was continually proving that as [a student in [the University of Human Nature]62-the university of human nature]1340-a student in the university of human nature [he]106-james had not even matriculated .

[Georgiana]119-georgiana appeared with an odd cup and saucer , and a giggling statement that [she]119-georgiana had not been able to discover any more teaspoons .

" Never mind , "[79-helen] said [Helen]79-helen . " [Mr. Prockter]95-emanuel shall have [mine]79-helen . "[79-helen]

" Well , [I]106-james 'm hanged ! "[106-james] reflected [James]106-james .

Whereupon [Georgiana]119-georgiana departed , bearing [her]119-georgiana own tea , into [[the giant]1308-the giant 's kitchen]1309-the giant 's kitchen . The miserable distinctions of class had been mysteriously established .

Contents Chapter 21

SHIP AND [OCEAN]147-ocean

[The host]1343-the host , [the hostess]927-the hostess , and [the guest]1345-the guest all remained on [their]1346-their feet in [the noble hall of [the Wilbrahams]135-the wilbrahams]1347-the noble hall of the wilbrahams , it not being good etiquette to sit at removals , even when company calls . [Emanuel]95-emanuel , fortunately for [him]95-emanuel , was adept at perambulation with a full cup of tea in one hand and a hat or so in the other . There were two things which [he]95-emanuel really could do - one was to sing a sentimental song without laughing , and the other was to balance a cup of tea . And it was only when [he]95-emanuel was doing the one or the other that [he]95-emanuel genuinely lived . During the remainder of [his]95-emanuel existence [he]95-emanuel was merely [a vegetable inside a waistcoat]1348-a vegetable inside a waistcoat . [He]95-emanuel held [his]95-emanuel cup without a tremor while [Helen]79-helen charmingly introduced into it [her]79-helen teaspoon and stirred up the sugar . Then , after [he]95-emanuel had sipped and pronounced the result excellent , be began to admire [the Hall]2083-the hall and the contents of [the Hall]2083-the hall . A proof of [his]95-emanuel real Christian charity was that , whereas [he]95-emanuel had meant to have [that Hall]1351-that hall for [himself]95-emanuel , [he]95-emanuel breathed no word of envy nor discontent . [He]95-emanuel praised everything and presently [he]95-emanuel arrived at [the ship]1290-the ship and [ocean]1291-ocean , and praised that . [He]95-emanuel particularly praised the waves .

The heart of [James]106-james instantly and instinctively softened towards [him]95-emanuel . For the realism of those foaming waves had always struck [James]106-james as the final miracle of art . And , moreover , this was the first time that [any of [Helen]79-helen 's haughty ' set]1354-any of helen 's haughty ' set " had ever deigned to recognise the merits of [the ship]1290-the ship and [ocean]1291-ocean .[79-helen]

" Where shouldst hang it , [Master Prockter]95-emanuel ? "[106-james] [James]106-james genially asked .

" Hang it , [uncle]1867-uncle ? "[79-helen] exclaimed [Helen]79-helen . " Are [you]1867-uncle going to hang it ? Are n't [you]1867-uncle going to keep it on the table in [[your]1867-uncle own room]2262-your own room ? "[79-helen]

[She]79-helen was hoping that it might occupy a position not too prominent . [She]79-helen did not intend it to be the central decorative attraction of [the palace]1355-the palace .

" [It]2263-it ought to be hung , "[95-emanuel] said [Emanuel]95-emanuel . " See , here are the little iron things for the nails . "[95-emanuel]

This gift of observation pleased [James]106-james . [Emanuel]95-emanuel was indeed beginning to show quite an intelligent interest in [the ship]1290-the ship and [ocean]1291-ocean .

" Of course it must be hung , "[95-emanuel] said [he]95-emanuel .

[He]95-emanuel was very human , was [Jimmy Ollerenshaw]74-james . For at least twenty - five years [he]95-emanuel had possessed [the ship]1290-the ship and [ocean]1291-ocean , and cherished [it]1360-it , always meaning one day to hang it against the wall as it deserved . And yet [he]95-emanuel had never arrived at doing so , though the firm resolution to do so had not a whit weakened in [his]95-emanuel mind . And now [he]95-emanuel was absolutely decided , with the whole force of [his]95-emanuel will behind [him]95-emanuel , to hang [the ship]1290-the ship and [ocean]1291-ocean at once .

" There ! under [[the musicians]2264-the musicians ' gallery]2265-the musicians ' gallery would n't be [a bad place]2266-a bad place , would it , [Mr. Ollerenshaw]74-james ? "[95-emanuel] [Emanuel]95-emanuel suggested , respectfully .

[James]74-james trained [his]74-james eye on the spot . " The very thing , [lad]2267-lad ! "[74-james] said [he]74-james , with enthusiasm .

" [Lad]148-lad ! "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen had not recovered from a private but extreme astonishment at this singular mark of paternal familiarity to [Emanuel]95-emanuel when there was another and a far louder ring at the door .

[Georgiana]119-georgiana minced and tripped out of [her]119-georgiana retreat , and opened the majestic portal to a still greater surprise for [Helen]79-helen . [The ringer]1363-the ringer was [Mr. Andrew Dean]113-andrew - [Mr. Andrew Dean]113-andrew with [his]113-andrew dark , quasi - hostile eyes , and [his]113-andrew heavy shoulders , and [his]113-andrew defiant , suspicious bearing - [Mr. Andrew Dean]113-andrew in workaday clothes and with hands that could not be called clean . [Andrew]113-andrew stared about [him]113-andrew like [a scout]1364-a scout , and then advanced rapidly to [Helen]79-helen and seized [her]79-helen hand , hurting it .

" [I]113-andrew was just passing , "[113-andrew] said , [he]113-andrew , in a hoarse voice . " [I]113-andrew expected [you]79-helen 'd be in a bit of a mess , so [I]113-andrew thought [I]113-andrew might be useful . How d'ye do , [Mr. Ollerenshaw]74-james ? "[113-andrew] And [he]113-andrew hurt [James]74-james 's hand also .

" It 's very kind of [you]113-andrew , "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen remarked , flushing .

" How do , [Prockter]95-emanuel ? "[113-andrew] [Andrew]113-andrew jerked out at [Emanuel]95-emanuel , not taking [his]95-emanuel hand .

This abstention on [Andrew]113-andrew 's part from physical violence was capable of two interpretations . The natural interpretation was that [Andrew]113-andrew 's social methods were notoriously casual and capricious . The interesting interpretation was that a failure of the negotiations between [Emanuel]95-emanuel and [Andrew]113-andrew for a partnership - a failure which had puzzled [Bursley]1-bursley - had left rancour behind it .

[Emanuel]95-emanuel , however , displayed no symptom of being disturbed . [His]95-emanuel blandness remained intact . Nevertheless , the atmosphere was mysteriously electric . [Helen]79-helen felt it to be so , and an atmosphere which is deemed to be electric by [even one person]1365-even one person only , ipso facto , is electric . As for [James Ollerenshaw]74-james , [he]74-james was certainly astonished by the visit of [Andrew Dean]113-andrew ; but , being absorbed in the welfare of [[his]74-james ship]1366-his ship and [ocean]1291-ocean , [he]74-james permitted [his]74-james astonishment , to dissolve in a vague satisfaction that , anyhow , [Helen]79-helen 's unexplained quarrel with [Andrew Dean]113-andrew was really at an end . This call was assuredly [Andrew]113-andrew 's way of expiatory repentance .

" The very thing ! "[113-andrew] [he]113-andrew repeated , glancing at [Emanuel]95-emanuel as if in expectation .

[Emanuel]95-emanuel did not seem to comprehend that aught was expected of [him]95-emanuel . [He]95-emanuel amiably stood , with hands still appropriately gloved , and [his]95-emanuel kindly glance wandered between [the ship]1290-the ship and [ocean]1291-ocean and the spot which [he]95-emanuel had hit on for [the ship]1290-the ship and [ocean]1291-ocean 's last resting - place .

" Where 's the steps , [Helen]79-helen ? "[74-james] [James]74-james inquired , and , after a brief silence : " [Georgiana]119-georgiana ! "[74-james] [he]74-james yelled .

[The girl]244-the girl flew in .

" Bring [us]2268-us a pair o ' steps , "[74-james] said [he]74-james .

Followed an unsuccessful search for the pair of steps , which [Andrew Dean]113-andrew ultimately discovered in a corner of [the hall itself]1373-the hall itself , lying flat behind a vast roll of carpet which was included in the goods purchased for seven thousand two hundred and fifty pounds . The steps being found , [Georgiana]119-georgiana explained at length how [she]119-georgiana distinctly remembered seeing [one of [the men]1298-the men]1374-one of the men put them behind the roll of carpet .

" Now , what is it ? "[113-andrew] [Andrew]113-andrew vigorously questioned . [He]113-andrew was prepared , evidently , to do anything that [a man]271-a man may do with a pair of steps . When the operation was indicated to [him]113-andrew , [his]113-andrew first act was to take off [his]113-andrew coat , which [he]113-andrew threw on the floor .

" Hammer ! Nails ! "[113-andrew] [he]113-andrew ejaculated . And [Georgiana]119-georgiana , intimidated by [his]113-andrew tone , contrived to find both hammer and nails . It is true that the hammer was a coal hammer .

And in a remarkably short space of time [he]113-andrew was balanced on the summit of the steps with a nail in one hand , a hammer in the other , a pencil behind [his]113-andrew ear , and another nail in [his]113-andrew mouth . [The other three]1377-the other three encircled [him]113-andrew from below , with upturned faces and open mouths , like young birds expecting food . Not that young birds expecting food wear gloves so appropriate to the occasion as were [Emanuel]95-emanuel 's . [James Ollerenshaw]74-james was impressed by the workmanlike manner in which [Andrew]113-andrew measured the width of the glass box and marked it off on the wall before beginning to knock nails . The presence of one nail in [Andrew]113-andrew 's mouth while [he]113-andrew was knocking in the other with a coal hammer , prevented [him]113-andrew from outraging the social code when the coal hammer embraced [his]113-andrew fingers as well as the nail in the field of its activity . Unhappily , when it came to the second nail , no such hindrance operated .

The nails , having been knocked in , were duly and satisfactorily tested .

Then [solemnly James]74-james seized the glass box containing [the ship]1290-the ship and ocean , and bore it with all possible precautions to the pair of steps in front of the great doors . [Andrew]113-andrew descended two storeys , and , bending [his]113-andrew body , received the box from [James]74-james as [a parson]1379-a parson receives [a baby at the font]1380-a baby at the font . [He]113-andrew then remounted . The steps rocked .

" [I]74-james 'd happen better hold 'em , "[74-james] said [James]74-james .

" It 'll be all right , "[113-andrew] said [Andrew]113-andrew .

" [I]95-emanuel 'll hold them , "[95-emanuel] said [Emanuel]95-emanuel , hastening forward .

The precise cause of the accident will probably never be known , but no sooner did [Emanuel]95-emanuel lay [his]95-emanuel gloved hand on the steps than the whole edifice , consisting of steps , [Andrew]113-andrew , and [ship]1381-ship and [ocean]1291-ocean tottered and fell .

" [Clumsy fool]2269-clumsy fool ! "[113-andrew] [Andrew]113-andrew was distinctly heard to exclaim during [his]113-andrew swift passage to the floor

[The ship]1290-the ship and [ocean]1291-ocean were incurably disintegrated into a mess of coloured cardboard , linen , and sticks .

And catastrophes even more dreadful might have occurred had it not been for the calm and wise tact of [Helen]79-helen . Where [a person]1385-a person is pleased by an event , [that person]1386-that person can usually , without too much difficulty , exercise a calm and wise tact upon [other persons whom the event has not pleased]1387-other persons whom the event has not pleased . And [Helen]79-helen was delighted by the catastrophe to [the ship]1290-the ship and [ocean]1291-ocean . [The ship]1290-the ship and [ocean]1291-ocean had formed no part in [her]79-helen scheme for the decoration of [the hall]2083-the hall ; [her]79-helen one poor solace had been that the relative proportions of [the hall]2083-the hall and of [the ship]1290-the ship and [ocean]1291-ocean were such that [even a careful observer]1396-even a careful observer might have spent hours in the former without discovering the latter ; on the other hand , [some blundering ninny]1397-some blundering ninny might have lighted instantly on [the ship]1290-the ship and [ocean]1291-ocean , and awkwardly inquired what it was doing there . So [Helen]79-helen was really enchanted by the ruin . [She]79-helen handled [[her]79-helen men]1400-her men with notable finesse : [Uncle James]106-james savage and vindictive , but uncertain upon whom to pour out [his]106-james anger ; [Emanuel]95-emanuel nursing [his]95-emanuel injured innocence ; and [Andrew Dean]113-andrew nursing [his]113-andrew elbow , [his]113-andrew head , and vengeance . [She]79-helen also found a moment in which to calm [Georgiana]119-georgiana , who had run flying and hysterical into [the hall]2083-the hall at the sound of the smash .

Even the steps were broken .

After a time harmony was established , both [Uncle James]106-james and [Emanuel]95-emanuel being , at bottom , [men of peace]1402-men of peace . But it was undeniable that [Uncle James]106-james had lost more than gold , and that [Emanuel]95-emanuel had been touched in a perilous place - [his]95-emanuel conceit of [himself]95-emanuel .

Then [Georgiana]119-georgiana swept up [the ship]1290-the ship and [ocean]1291-ocean , and [James]106-james retired to [[his]106-james own little room]1405-his own little room , where [he]106-james assumed [his]106-james Turkish cap , and began to arrange [his]106-james personal effects in a manner definite and final , which would be a law for ever to [the servants of [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall]1406-the servants of wilbraham hall .

Left with [the two young men]1407-the two young men , [Helen]79-helen went from triumph to triumph . In quite a few minutes [she]79-helen had [them]1407-the two young men actually talking to [each other]456-each other . And [she]79-helen ended by speeding [them]1407-the two young men away together . And by the time [they]1407-the two young men departed [each]1409-each was convinced that [Georgiana]119-georgiana 's apron , on [Helen]79-helen , was one of the most bewitching manifestations of the inexpressibly feminine that [he]106-james had ever been privileged to see .

[They]1407-the two young men took [themselves]1407-the two young men off by a door at the farther end of [the hall]2083-the hall behind the stairs , whence there was a short cut through [the undulating grounds]1411-the undulating grounds to [the main road]1412-the main road .

[Helen]79-helen ascended to [the state bedroom]1304-the state bedroom , where there was simply everything to be done ; [Georgiana]119-georgiana followed [her]79-helen , after having made up the fires , and , while helping to unpack boxes , offered gossamer hints - fluffy , scarcely palpable , elusive things - to [[her]119-georgiana mistress]1414-her mistress that [her]119-georgiana real ambition had always been to be [a lady's - maid]1415-a lady's - maid , and to be served at meals by [the third , or possibly the fourth , housemaid]1416-the third , or possibly the fourth , housemaid . And [the hall of [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall]1282-the hall of wilbraham hall was abandoned for [a space to silence and solitude]1418-a space to silence and solitude .

Now , the window of [[Uncle James]106-james 's little room]1419-uncle james 's little room was a little window that lived modestly between the double pillars of [the portico]1420-the portico and the first window of [the great dining - room]1056-the great dining - room . Resting from [his]106-james labours of sorting and placing , [he]106-james gazed forth at [[his]106-james domain]1422-his domain , and mechanically calculated what profit would accrue to [him]106-james if [he]106-james cut off a slip a hundred and fifty feet deep along by [the Oldcastle - road]1423-the oldcastle - road , and sold [it]1424-it in lots for [villas]1425-villas , or built [villas]1425-villas and sold them on ninety - nine - year leases . [He]106-james was engaged in [his]106-james happy exercise of mental arithmetic when [he]106-james heard footsteps crunching the gravel , and then a figure , which had evidently come round by the north side from the back of [the Hall]2083-the hall , passed across [the field of]1428-the field of [James]106-james 's vision . [This figure]1429-this figure was a walking baptism to the ground [it]1429-this figure trod . It dripped water plenteously . [It]1429-this figure was , in a word , soaked , and [its]1429-this figure garments clung to [it]1429-this figure . [Its]1429-this figure yellow chamois gloves clung to [its]1429-this figure hands . [It]1429-this figure had no hat . [It]1429-this figure hesitated in front of the entrance .

[Uncle James]106-james pushed up [his]106-james window . " What 's amiss , [lad]2267-lad ? "[106-james] [he]106-james inquired , with a certain blandness of satisfaction .

" [I]95-emanuel fell into [the Water]2271-the water , "[95-emanuel] said [Emanuel]95-emanuel , feebly , meaning the sheet known as [Wilbraham Water]43-wilbraham water , which diversified [the park - like splendours of [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall]1430-the park - like splendours of wilbraham hall .

" How didst manage that ? "[1429-this figure]

" The path is very muddy and slippery just there , "[95-emanuel] said [Emanuel]95-emanuel .

" Had n't [you]95-emanuel better run [home]1773-home as quick as may be ? "[106-james] [James]106-james suggested .

" [I]95-emanuel ca n't , "[95-emanuel] said [Emanuel]95-emanuel .

" Why not ? "[1429-this figure]

" [I]106-james 've got no hat , and [I]106-james 'm all wet . And [everybody in [Oldcastle - road]61-oldcastle - road]2273-everybody in oldcastle - road will see [me]106-james . Can [you]106-james lend [me]106-james a hat and coat ? "[106-james]

And all the while [he]106-james was steadily baptising the gravel .

[Uncle James]106-james 's head disappeared for a moment , and then [he]106-james threw out of the window a stiff yellow mackintosh of great age . It was [his]106-james rent - collecting mackintosh . [It]1431-it had the excellent quality of matching the chamois gloves .

[Emanuel]95-emanuel thankfully took it . " And what about a cap or something ? "[106-james] [he]106-james plaintively asked .

" Tak ' this , "[106-james] said [Uncle James]106-james , with remarkable generosity whipping the Turkish cap from [his]106-james own head , and handing it to [Emanuel]95-emanuel .

[Emanuel]95-emanuel hesitated , then accepted ; and , thus uniquely attired , sped away , still baptising .

At tea tea [proper James]106-james recounted this episode to [a somewhat taciturn and preoccupied Helen]79-helen .

" [He]106-james did n't fall into the Water , "[79-helen] said [Helen]79-helen , curtly . " [Andrew Dean]113-andrew pushed [him]106-james in . "[79-helen]

" How dost know that ? "[1432-she]

" [Georgiana]119-georgiana and [I]79-helen saw it from [[my]79-helen bedroom]2274-my bedroom window . It was [she]119-georgiana who first saw [them]2275-them fighting , or at any rate arguing . Then [Andrew Dean]113-andrew charged [him]106-james in , as if [they]2275-them were playing football , and walked on ; and [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel scrambled out . "[79-helen]

" H'm ! "[106-james] reflected [James]106-james . " Well , if [ye]119-georgiana ask [me]106-james , [lass]1738-lass , [Emanuel]95-emanuel brought that on [himsen]106-james . [She]1432-she rose from the table , in sudden and speechless indignation .

" [You]1432-she should ha ' seen [him]95-emanuel , [lass]1738-lass ! "[106-james] said [James]106-james , and added : " [I]106-james wish [ye]1432-she had ! "[106-james] [He]106-james tried to be calm . But [she]1432-she had sprung on [him]106-james another of [her]1432-she disconcerting surprises . [She]1432-she sat down again . " [I]1432-she know why [you]106-james say that , [uncle]1867-uncle "[1432-she] - [she]1432-she looked [him]106-james in the face , and put [her]1432-she elbows on the table . " Now , just listen to [me]1432-she ! "[1432-she]

Highly perturbed , [he]106-james wondered what was coming next .

[Contents]149-contents Chapter 22

CONFESSIONAL

" What 's the matter with [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel ? "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen asked ; meaning , what were the implied faults of [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel .

There was defiance in [her]79-helen tone . [She]79-helen had risen from the table , and [she]79-helen had sat down again , and [she]79-helen seemed by [her]79-helen pose to indicate that [she]79-helen had sat down again with a definite purpose , a purpose to do grievous harm to the soul 's peace of [anybody who differed from the statements which [she]79-helen was about to enunciate , or who gave the wrong sort of answers to [her]79-helen catechism]1433-anybody who differed from the statements which she was about to enunciate , or who gave the wrong sort of answers to her catechism . [She]79-helen was wearing [her]79-helen black mousseline dress theoretically " done with "[79-helen] , which in its younger days always had the effect of rousing [the grande dame]1434-the grande dame in [her]79-helen . [She]79-helen laid [her]79-helen ringless hands , lightly clasped , on a small , heavy , round mahogany table which stood in the middle of [the little drawing - room]1435-the little drawing - room , and [she]79-helen looked over [James]106-james 's shoulder into the vistas of [the great drawing - room]1055-the great drawing - room . The sombre , fading magnificence of [the Wilbrahams]135-the wilbrahams - a magnificence of dark woods , tasselled curtains , reps , and gilt - was [[her]79-helen theatre]1437-her theatre , and [the theatre]1438-the theatre suited [her]79-helen mood .

Still , [Jimmy Ollerenshaw]74-james , somewhat embittered by the catastrophe of the afternoon , conceived that [he]74-james was not going to be brow - beaten .

" What 's the matter with [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel , "[74-james] said [he]74-james , " is as [he]95-emanuel 's probably gotten a cold by this . "[74-james]

" Yes , and [you]74-james 're glad ! "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen retorted . " [You]74-james think [he]95-emanuel looked [a fool]1982-a fool after [he]95-emanuel 'd been in [the water]2271-the water . And [you]74-james were glad . "[79-helen]

" [I]74-james dunna think , "[74-james] said [James]74-james , " [I]74-james 'm sure . "[74-james]

" But why should [you]74-james be glad ? That 's what [I]79-helen want to know . "[79-helen]

[James]74-james could not sagaciously reply to this query . [He]74-james merely scratched [his]74-james head , tilting one of [his]74-james Turkish caps to that end .

" The fact is , "[79-helen] [she]79-helen cried , with a grammatical carelessness which was shocking in [a woman who had professed to teach everything]1439-a woman who had professed to teach everything , " [every one]924-every one has got [their]924-every one knives into [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel . And it 's simply because [he]95-emanuel 's good - looking and well - dressed and sings beautifully . "[79-helen]

" Good - looking ! "[74-james] murmured [James]74-james .

" Well , is n't [he]95-emanuel ? "[79-helen]

" [He]95-emanuel 's pretty , "[74-james] said [James]74-james .

" [No one]1076-no one ever said [he]95-emanuel had a lot of brains "[79-helen]

" [I]74-james never did , "[74-james] [James]74-james put in .

" But what does that matter ? [He]95-emanuel is polite . [He]95-emanuel does know how to behave [himself]95-emanuel in polite society . If [Andrew Dean]113-andrew pushed [him]95-emanuel into [the water]2271-the water , that was n't [his]95-emanuel fault . [Andrew]113-andrew is stronger than [he]113-andrew is , but that 's no credit to [Andrew Dean]113-andrew . It 's to [his]113-andrew discredit . [Andrew Dean]113-andrew is nothing but [a bully]2286-a bully - [we]2287-we all know that . [He]95-emanuel might have pushed [you]74-james into [the water]2271-the water , or [me]79-helen . "[79-helen]

" [He]95-emanuel might , "[74-james] [James]74-james admitted , " if [I]74-james 'd been silly enough to get between [the water]2271-the water and [him]95-emanuel . "[74-james]

" And [I]79-helen should like to know who looked [a fool]1982-a fool when [Andrew Dean]113-andrew fell off those steps . And just listen to the language [the man]1736-the man used . [I]79-helen will say this for [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel - [I]79-helen never heard [him]95-emanuel swear . "[79-helen]

" No , "[74-james] said [James]74-james . " [He]95-emanuel wears gloves . [He]95-emanuel even wears 'em when [he]95-emanuel takes [his]95-emanuel bath of a November afternoon . "[74-james]

" [I]79-helen do n't care who knows it , "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen observed , hotly , " [I]79-helen like [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel . "[79-helen]

" There 's [nobody]274-nobody as dunna ' know it , "[74-james] said [James]74-james . " It 's the talk of [Bursley]1-bursley as [you]79-helen 've set [your]79-helen cap at [him]95-emanuel . "[74-james]

" [I]79-helen do n't wear caps , "[79-helen] said [Helen]79-helen . " [I]79-helen 'm not [a servant]623-a servant . "[79-helen]

" Hat , then , "[74-james] [James]74-james corrected [himself]74-james . " [Ye'll]79-helen not deny as [you]79-helen wear hats , [I]74-james reckon . [I]74-james 've seen [ye]79-helen in forty . "[74-james]

" [I]79-helen know who started that tale , "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen exploded . " [Andrew Dean]113-andrew started that tale . "[79-helen]

" No , "[74-james] said [James]74-james . " It was [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter , [I]74-james 'm thinking . "[74-james]

" Has [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter spoken to [you]74-james about [me]79-helen and - and [Emanuel]95-emanuel ? "[79-helen]

[James]74-james hesitated . But the devil - may - care , agreeably vicious [Ollerenshaw]74-james impulses were afoot in [him]74-james , and [he]74-james did not hesitate long .

" [Her]84-mrs. prockter has , "[74-james] said [he]74-james .

" What [a ridiculous , fat old woman]2294-a ridiculous , fat old woman [she]84-mrs. prockter is , with [her]84-mrs. prockter fancies ! "[74-james]

Frankly , [James]74-james did not like this . [He]74-james was in a mind to resent it , and then a certain instinct of self - preservation prompted [him]74-james to seek cover in silence . But in any battle of the sexes silence is no cover to [the male]1440-the male , as [he]74-james ought to have known .

[Helen]79-helen pursued [him]74-james behind [his]74-james cover . " [I]79-helen wonder who [she]84-mrs. prockter 's setting [her]84-mrs. prockter cap at ? [I]79-helen suppose [you]74-james 'll not deny that [she]84-mrs. prockter wears a cap ? "[79-helen]

It was quite a long time since [James Ollerenshaw]74-james had blushed ; but [he]74-james blushed at these words . Nothing could have been more foolish , inept , on [his]74-james part . Why should be blush because [Helen]79-helen expressed a vague , hostile curiosity as to -the direction of [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter 's cap ? What had the direction of [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter 's cap to do with [him]74-james ? Yet blush [he]74-james did . [He]74-james grew angry , not - curiously enough - with [Helen]79-helen , but with [himself]74-james and with [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter . [His]74-james anger had the strange effect of making [him]74-james [an arrant coward]1441-an arrant coward . [He]74-james got up from [his]74-james chair , having pushed away [his]74-james cup towards the centre of the table . As tea was over [he]74-james was within [his]74-james rights in doing so .

" [I]74-james mun be getting to work again , "[74-james] [he]74-james muttered .

" Please do wait a minute , [uncle]1867-uncle , "[79-helen] [she]79-helen said imperiously . " Ca n't [you]1867-uncle see [I]79-helen want to talk to [you]1867-uncle ? Ca n't [you]1867-uncle see [I]79-helen 've got something on [my]79-helen mind ? "[79-helen]

Deliberately challenged in this way , [the formidable James]74-james was no more than a sheep to [the shearer]1442-the shearer . Until [he]74-james met [Helen]79-helen , [he]74-james had perhaps never received deliberate , audacious challenges and even now [he]74-james was far from being accustomed to them . So [he]74-james just stood foolishly near [his]74-james chair

" [I]74-james ca n't talk to [you]74-james while [you]74-james 're standing up , [she]79-helen said .[74-james]

So [he]74-james sat down . How simple it ought to have been for [him]74-james to exert authority over [Helen]79-helen , to tell [her]79-helen fiercely that [he]74-james had no intention of being talked to like that , and that if [she]79-helen persisted in such tactics the front door was at [her]79-helen entire disposal ! [She]79-helen had no claim on [him]74-james . Yet [he]74-james ate [his]74-james humble pie and sat down .

" So [they]2296-they are saying that there is something between [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel and [me]79-helen , are [they]2296-they ? "[79-helen] [she]79-helen recommenced , in a new , mollified voice , a voice that waved the white flag over [her]79-helen head .

" It wouldna ' surprise [me]74-james to hear as [they]2296-they were , "[74-james] said [James]74-james .

" And supposing there was something between [us]2296-they , [uncle]1867-uncle , should [you]1867-uncle mind ? "[79-helen]

" [I]74-james do n't know as [I]74-james should mind , "[74-james] said [he]74-james " And [I]79-helen do n't know as it ' ud matter a brass button if [I]79-helen did mind . "[79-helen]

" What should [you]1867-uncle do , [uncle]1867-uncle ? "[79-helen]

" [I]74-james should do as [I]74-james 've always done , "[74-james] said [he]74-james ; " eat and sleep and take [my]74-james walks abroad . [Them]2296-they as wants to marry will marry , and [they]2296-they will marry what suits 'em . But [I]74-james shall tak ' [my]74-james meat and drink as usual . "[74-james]

" Would [you]1867-uncle come to the wedding ? "[79-helen]

" [I]74-james 've only got a funeral suit , "[74-james] said [he]74-james . " But [I]74-james 'd buy [me]74-james some togs if [Emanuel]95-emanuel ' ud tak ' this place off [my]74-james hands at what [I]74-james gave . "[74-james]

" Would [you]1867-uncle give [me]79-helen a wedding - present ? "[79-helen]

" [I]74-james 'd give [thee]74-james some advice . It 's what [thou'rt]74-james most in need of . "[74-james]

[His]74-james tone was gloomy and resigned .

[She]1443-she slipped round the table and sat on the arm of [his]74-james chair .

" [You]74-james are a horrid old thing , "[1443-she] [she]1443-she told [him]74-james - not for the first time . " [I]1443-she am in need of advice . And there 's [no one]1076-no one can give it [me]1443-she but [you]74-james . "[1443-she]

" Nay , nay ! "[74-james] [he]74-james recoiled . " There 's [Sarah Swetnam]107-sarah . [You]74-james 're as thick as [thieves]2300-thieves . "[74-james]

" [She]107-sarah 's [the very last person [I]79-helen can go to]2301-the very last person i can go to , "[79-helen] said [Helen]79-helen .

" And why ? "[1443-she]

" Because [Andrew]113-andrew is engaged to [[her]107-sarah sister]864-her sister , of course . That 's the awful part of it , "[1443-she]

" Ay ? "[74-james] [he]74-james questioned .

" Yes . Because , [you]74-james see , it 's [Andrew Dean]113-andrew that [I]79-helen 'm in love with . "[79-helen]

[She]79-helen said it in very pert and airy accents . And then the next moment [she]79-helen put [James]74-james into terrible consternation by crying , and clutching [his]74-james arm . [He]74-james saw that [she]79-helen was serious . Light beat down upon [him]74-james . [He]74-james had to blink and collect [himself]74-james .

" [I]74-james ' [[thy]79-helen place]2303-thy place , [lass]1738-lass , "[74-james] [he]74-james said , " [I]74-james should keep that to [mysen]74-james . "[74-james]

" But [I]79-helen ca n't , [uncle]1867-uncle . That is , [I]79-helen have n't done . [Andrew]113-andrew knows . [You]1867-uncle do n't understand how much [I]79-helen 'm in love with [him]113-andrew . [I]79-helen 've - [he]113-andrew 's - "[79-helen]

" [Thou'st]79-helen not kissed [him]113-andrew ? "[74-james]

" Not exactly - but - "[79-helen]

[Helen]79-helen nodded .

" [Helen]79-helen , what ' ud [[thy]79-helen mother]2307-thy mother say ? "[79-helen]

" It was because of [Andrew Dean]113-andrew that [I]79-helen came to live in [Bursley]1-bursley , "[79-helen] said [she]79-helen . " [I]79-helen knew [I]79-helen should n't see [him]113-andrew often enough if [I]79-helen stayed in [Longshaw]7-longshaw . So [I]79-helen came [here]1785-here . [You]2309-you know [we]2310-we had always liked [each other]456-each other , [I]79-helen think , ever since [he]113-andrew spent two years at [Longshaw]7-longshaw at [Spitz Brothers]150-spitz brothers ' . Then [I]79-helen did n't see [him]113-andrew for some time . [You]2309-you know how rude and awkward [he]113-andrew is . Well , there was a coolness . And then [we]2310-we did n't see [each other]456-each other for another long time . And then when [I]79-helen next saw [him]113-andrew [I]79-helen knew [I]79-helen really was in love with [him]113-andrew . Of course , [I]79-helen never said anything to [mother]1743-mother . [One]371-one does n't , [you]2309-you know . And [she]1743-mother was so taken up with [her]1743-mother own affairs , [poor dear]2315-poor dear ! And [I]79-helen thought [he]113-andrew was really fond of [me]79-helen . [I]79-helen thought so because [he]113-andrew was so cross and queer . [He]113-andrew 's like that , [you]2309-you know . And , after all , it was not that that made [him]113-andrew cross and queer . It was just because [he]113-andrew was as good as engaged to [Lilian]112-lilian , and [he]113-andrew did n't like to tell [me]79-helen . And [I]79-helen never knew . How could [I]79-helen guess ? [I]79-helen 'd never heard there was anything between [him]113-andrew and [Lilian]112-lilian . And besides , although [he]113-andrew was cross and queer , [he]113-andrew said things to [me]79-helen that [he]113-andrew ought n't to have said , considering how [he]113-andrew was carrying on with [Lilian]112-lilian . It was then that [I]79-helen settled on coming to [Bursley]1-bursley . There was no reason why [I]79-helen should stay in [Longshaw]7-longshaw . [I]79-helen saw [him]113-andrew again in [Longshaw]7-longshaw , after [he]113-andrew was engaged to [Lilian]112-lilian , and yet [he]113-andrew never told [me]79-helen ! And then , when [I]79-helen come [here]1785-here , the first thing [I]79-helen hear is that [he]113-andrew 's engaged to [Lilian]112-lilian . It was that afternoon when [Sarah]107-sarah called ; do [you]1444-you remember , [uncle]1867-uncle ? "[79-helen]

[He]1444-you remembered .

" [I]1445-i saw [Mr. Dean]113-andrew that night , and somehow [I]1445-i told [him]113-andrew what [I]1445-i thought of [him]113-andrew . [I]1445-i do n't know how it began ; but it did . [He]113-andrew said [he]113-andrew could n't help being engaged to [Lilian]112-lilian . [He]113-andrew said it was one of those engagements that go on by [themselves]2318-themselves , and [you]1444-you ca n't stop [them]2318-themselves . [He]113-andrew wanted to stop it . But [he]113-andrew was engaged before [he]113-andrew knew where [he]113-andrew was - so [he]113-andrew says . [He]113-andrew said [he]113-andrew preferred [me]1445-i , and if [he]113-andrew 'd known - So of course [I]1445-i was obliged to be very angry with [him]113-andrew . That was why [I]1445-i did n't . speak to [him]113-andrew at first at [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter 's ; at least , that was partly why . The other reason was that [he]113-andrew had accused [me]1445-i of running after [Emanuel]95-emanuel - of [all people]2319-all people ! [I]1445-i had been , [you]2320-you know . But what had that got to do with [Andrew]113-andrew , seeing that [he]113-andrew was engaged to [Lilian]112-lilian ? Besides , [I]1445-i 'd been doing it on purpose . And [he]113-andrew was so insolent . And then , to crown all , [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter makes [me]1445-i dance with [him]113-andrew . No wonder [I]1445-i fainted ! [He]113-andrew is [the rudest , rudest , cruelest man [I]1445-i ever knew]2321-the rudest , rudest , cruelest man i ever knew . "[1445-i]

[She]1445-i wiped [her]1445-i eyes .

" H'm ! "[74-james] mused [James]74-james .

" [He]113-andrew 'll simply kill poor little [Lilian]112-lilian ! "[1445-i] [she]1445-i sobbed .

" What 's that got to do with [you]74-james , if [you]74-james and [Emanuel]95-emanuel has got nothing to do with [him]113-andrew ? It is n't [you]74-james as'll be hung when [Lilian]112-lilian 's murdered . "[1445-i]

" Ca n't [you]74-james see [he]113-andrew must n't marry [Lilian]112-lilian ? "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen burst out . " Silly little thing ! How can [she]112-lilian understand [him]113-andrew ? [She]112-lilian 's miles beneath [him]113-andrew . "[79-helen]

" Is there [anybody]517-anybody as does understand [him]113-andrew ? "[74-james] [James]74-james asked .

[I]1445-i wanted to tell [you]74-james , and now [I]1445-i 've told [you]74-james . Do n't [you]74-james think [I]1445-i 've done right in being quite open with [you]74-james ? [Most girls]2323-most girls are so foolish in these things . But [I]1445-i 'm not . Are n't [you]74-james glad , [uncle]1867-uncle ? "[1445-i]

" [You]74-james must help [me]1445-i , "[1445-i] [she]1445-i repeated .

Contents Chapter 23

NOCTURNAL

Many things which previously had not been plain to [James Ollerenshaw]74-james were plain to [him]74-james that night , as , in the solitude of [[his]74-james chosen room]1446-his chosen room , [he]74-james reflected upon the astonishing menu that [Helen]79-helen had offered [him]74-james by way of supplement to [his]74-james tea . But the chief matter in [his]74-james mind was the great , central , burning , blinding fact of the endless worry caused to [him]74-james by [his]74-james connection with the chit . [He]74-james had bought [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall under [her]79-helen threat to leave [him]74-james if [he]74-james did not buy it . Even at [Trafalgar]24-trafalgar - road - road [she]79-helen had filled [the little house with worry]1447-the little house with worry . And now , within a dozen hours of arriving in [it]34-wilbraham hall , [she]79-helen had filled [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall with worry - filled [it]34-wilbraham hall to [[its]34-wilbraham hall farthest attic]1448-its farthest attic . If [she]79-helen had selected [it]34-wilbraham hall as [a residence]1449-a residence , [she]79-helen would have filled [the Vatican]64-the vatican with worry . All that [James]74-james demanded was a quiet life ; and [she]79-helen would not let [him]74-james have it . [He]74-james wished [he]74-james was back again in [Trafalgar - road]24-trafalgar - road . [He]74-james wished [he]74-james had never met [Helen]79-helen and [her]79-helen sunshade in [the park]188-the park .

That is to say , [he]74-james asserted to [himself]74-james positively that [he]74-james wished [he]74-james had never met [Helen]79-helen . But [he]74-james did not mean it .

And so [he]74-james was to help [her]79-helen to wrest [Andrew Dean]113-andrew from [Lilian Swetnam]112-lilian ! [He]74-james was to take part in a shameful conspiracy ! [He]74-james was to assist in ruining [an innocent child]1451-an innocent child 's happiness ! And [he]74-james was deliberately to foster the raw material of a scandal in which [he]74-james [himself]74-james would be involved ! [He]74-james , [the strong , obstinate , self - centred old man]1452-the strong , obstinate , self - centred old man who had never , till [Helen]79-helen 's advent , done anything except to suit [his]74-james own convenience !

The one bright spot was that [Helen]79-helen had no genuine designs on [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel . As [a son - in - law]1453-a son - in - law , [Andrew Dean]113-andrew would be unbearable ; but [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel would have been - well ; impossible . [Andrew Dean]113-andrew [he]113-andrew mused was at any rate [a man whom [you]1455-you could talk to and look at without feeling sick]1454-a man whom you could talk to and look at without feeling sick .

When [he]113-andrew had gazed at the affair from all points of view , and repeated to [himself]113-andrew the same deep moral truths such as " There 's no doing nowt wi ' [a young woman]238-a young woman afore [she]238-a young woman 's forty "[113-andrew] about thirty - nine times , and pitied [himself]113-andrew from every quarter of the compass , [he]113-andrew rose to go to bed ; [he]113-andrew did not expect to sleep . But the gas was not yet in order , and [he]113-andrew had only one candle , which was nearly at its latter end . [The ladies]1456-the ladies - [Helen]79-helen and [Georgiana]119-georgiana - had retired long since .

[He]113-andrew left [[his]113-andrew little room]1457-his little room , and was just setting forth on the adventure of discovering [[his]113-andrew bed - chamber]1458-his bed - chamber , when a bell rang in the bowels of [the house]475-the house . [His]113-andrew flesh crept . It was as if -

" the clock struck twelve , and shook [the silent tower]2326-the silent tower . "[113-andrew]

Then [he]113-andrew collected [his]113-andrew powers of memory and of induction , and recognised in the sound of the bell the sound of the front door bell . [Some one]1863-some one must be at the front door . The singular and highly - disturbing phenomena of distant clanging , of thrills , and of flesh creepings were all resolved into the simple fact that [some one]1863-some one was at the front door .

[He]113-andrew went back into [[his]113-andrew little room]1457-his little room ; instead of opening the front door like [a man]271-a man , [he]113-andrew opened the window of [the little room]667-the little room , and stuck out the tassel of [his]113-andrew cap .

" Who 's there ? "[113-andrew] [he]113-andrew demanded .

" It 's [I]113-andrew , [Mr. Ollerenshaw]74-james , "[113-andrew] said a voice , queenly and nervous .

" Not [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter ? "[113-andrew] [he]113-andrew suggested .

" Yes . "[1465-she]

" [I]113-andrew reckon [ye'd]1465-she like to come in "[113-andrew] [he]113-andrew said .

[She]1465-she admitted the desire with a laugh which struck [him]113-andrew as excessively free . [He]113-andrew did not know whether to be glad or sorry that [Helen]79-helen had departed to bed . [He]113-andrew did not even know whether to be glad or sorry that [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter had called . But [he]113-andrew vividly remembered what [Helen]79-helen had said about caps .

Naturally , [he]113-andrew had to let [her]79-helen in . [He]113-andrew held the candle in [his]113-andrew left hand , as [he]113-andrew opened the door with [his]113-andrew right , and the tassel of [his]113-andrew cap was over [his]113-andrew eye .

" [You]74-james 'll think [I]1465-she 'm in the habit of calling on [you]74-james at night , "[1465-she] said [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter , as [she]1465-she slid through [the narrow space which [James]74-james allotted to [her]1465-she]1466-the narrow space which james allotted to her , and [she]1465-she laughed again . " Where is [dear [Helen]79-helen]2327-dear helen ? "[1465-she]

" [She]79-helen 's gone to bed , [missis]1973-missis , "[74-james] said [James]74-james , holding high the candle and gazing at the generous vision in front of [him]74-james . [It]1467-it wore a bonnet , and a rich Paisley shawl over its flowered silk .

" But it 's only ten o'clock ! "[84-mrs. prockter] [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter protested .

" Yes . But [her]79-helen 's gone to bed . "[84-mrs. prockter]

" Why , "[84-mrs. prockter] [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter exclaimed , changing the subject wilfully , " [you]1469-you are all straight here ! "[84-mrs. prockter] For the carpets had been unrolled and laid .

And [she]1465-she sat down on a massive Early Victorian mahogany chair about fifteen feet from the dying fire , and began to fan [herself]1465-she with [her]1465-she hands . [She]1465-she was [one of [[your]1469-you women]1470-your women who are never cold]1468-one of your women who are never cold .

[James]74-james , having nothing to say , said nothing , following [his]74-james custom .

" [I]84-mrs. prockter 'm not ill - pleased , "[84-mrs. prockter] said [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter " that [Helen]79-helen is out of the way . The fact is - it was [you]1469-you that [I]84-mrs. prockter wanted to have a word with . [You]1469-you 'll guess what about ? "[84-mrs. prockter]

" [Mr. Emanuel]95-emanuel ? "[74-james] [James]74-james hazarded .

" Precisely . [I]84-mrs. prockter had to put [him]95-emanuel to bed . [He]95-emanuel is certainly in for a very serious cold , and [I]84-mrs. prockter trust - [I]84-mrs. prockter fervently trust - it may not be bronchitis . That would mean [nurses]2329-nurses , and nothing upsets [a house]729-a house more than [nurses]2329-nurses . What happened , [Mr. Ollerenshaw]74-james ? "[84-mrs. prockter]

[James]74-james set the candle down on another Early Victorian chair , there being no occasional table at hand , and very slowly lowered [himself]74-james to a sitting posture on a third .

" [I]74-james 'll tell [you]1471-she what happened , [missis]1973-missis , "[74-james] [he]74-james said , putting [his]74-james hands on [his]74-james knees .

And [he]74-james told [her]1471-she , beginning with the loss of [the ship]1290-the ship and [ocean]1291-ocean , and ending with [Helen]79-helen 's ever memorable words : " [You]1471-she must help [me]74-james . "[74-james]

" That 's what happened , [missis]1973-missis , "[74-james] [he]74-james said , grimly .

[She]1471-she had punctuated [his]74-james recital by several exclamations , and when [he]74-james had finished [she]1471-she gave rein to [her]1471-she sentiments .

" [[My]1471-she dear]2065-my dear [Mr. Ollerenshaw]74-james , "[1471-she] [she]1471-she said , in the kindest manner conceivable , " how [I]1471-she sympathise with [you]74-james ! How [I]1471-she wish [I]1471-she could help [you]74-james ! "[1471-she]

[Her]1471-she sympathy was a genuine comfort to [him]74-james . [He]74-james did not , in that instant , care a fig for [Helen]79-helen 's notion about the direction of caps . [He]74-james was simply and humanly eased by the sweet tones of [this ample and comely dame]1474-this ample and comely dame . Besides , the idea of [a woman such as [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter]1475-a woman such as mrs. prockter marrying [a man such as [him]74-james]1476-a man such as him was [he]74-james knew preposterous . [She]1471-she belonged to [a little world which called [him]74-james " [Jimmy]74-james]2335-a little world which called him " jimmy , "[1471-she] whereas [he]74-james belonged to [a little world of [his]74-james own]1477-a little world of his own . True , [he]74-james was wealthy but [she]1471-she was not poor - and no amount of money [he]74-james thought could make a bridge to join those two worlds . Nevertheless , here [she]1471-she was , talking to [him]74-james alone at ten o'clock at night - and not for the first time , either ! Obviously , then , there was no nonsense about [her]1471-she , whatever nonsensical world [she]1471-she belonged to .

[She]1471-she ran over with sympathy . Having no further fear of [Helen]79-helen making trouble in [[her]79-helen own family]1478-her own family , [she]1471-she had all [her]1471-she feelings at liberty to condone with [James]74-james .

The candle , throwing a small hemisphere of feeble radiance in the vastness of [the dim hall]1479-the dim hall , sat on its chair between [them]1480-them .

" [I]1471-she can help [you]74-james , "[1471-she] [she]1471-she said , suddenly , after grunts from [James]74-james . " [I]1471-she 'm calling on [the Swetnams]151-the swetnams the day after to - morrow . [I]1471-she 'll tell [them]1480-them about - about to - day , and when [Mrs. Swetnam]152-mrs. swetnam asks [me]1471-she for an explanation of it , [I]1471-she will be mysterious . If [Lilian]112-lilian is [there]252-there , [Mrs. Swetnam]152-mrs. swetnam will certainly get [her]112-lilian out of [the room]499-the room . Then [I]1471-she will just give the faintest hint that the explanation is merely jealousy between [Emanuel]95-emanuel and [Mr. Dean]113-andrew concerning - [a certain young lady]2338-a certain young lady . [I]1471-she shall treat it all as a joke ; [you]2339-you can rely on [me]1471-she . Immediately [I]1471-she am gone [Lilian]112-lilian will hear about it . [She]112-lilian will quarrel with [Andrew]113-andrew the next time [she]112-lilian sees [him]113-andrew ; and if [he]113-andrew wishes to be free , [he]113-andrew may be ! "[1471-she]

[She]1481-she smiled the arch , naughty , pleasantly - malign smile of [a terribly experienced dowager]1482-a terribly experienced dowager . And [she]1481-she seemed positively anxious that [James]74-james should have [Andrew Dean]113-andrew for [a son - in - law]1453-a son - in - law .

[James]74-james , in [his]74-james simplicity , was delighted . It appeared to [him]74-james a Mephistophelian ingenuity . [He]74-james thought how [clever women]1484-clever women were , on [their]1484-clever women own ground , and what an advantage [they]1484-clever women had in [their]1484-clever women immense lack of scruple .

" Of course , "[1481-she] said [she]1481-she , " [I]1481-she have always said that a marriage between [Andrew Dean]113-andrew and [Lilian]112-lilian would be a mistake - a very serious mistake . [They]2340-they are quite unsuited to each other . [She]1481-she is n't in love with [him]113-andrew - [she]1481-she 's only been flattered by [his]113-andrew attentions into drawing [him]113-andrew on . [I]1481-she feel sorry for the little thing . "[1481-she]

At a stroke , [she]1481-she had converted a shameful conspiracy into an act of the highest virtue . And [her]1481-she smile changed , too - became a good smile , a smile on which [a man]271-a man might depend . [His]74-james heart went out to [her]1481-she , and [he]74-james contemplated the smile in a pleased , beatific silence .

Just then the candle - a treacherous thing - flamed up and went out .

" Oh ! "[84-mrs. prockter] cried [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter .

And [James]74-james had not a match . [He]74-james never smoked . And without an atlas of [the Hall]2083-the hall , showing the location of match - boxes , [he]74-james saw no hope of finding a match .

The fire was as good as gone . A few cinders burnt red under the ash , showing the form of the chimney - piece , but no more .

" An [ye]1481-she got a match ? "[74-james] [he]74-james asked [her]1481-she .

" No , "[1481-she] [she]1481-she said , drily , " [I]1481-she do n't carry matches . But [I]1481-she can tell [you]74-james [I]1481-she do n't like being in the dark at all . "[1481-she] [Her]1481-she voice came to [him]74-james out of nothing , and had a most curious effect on [his]74-james spine .

" Where are [you]74-james , [Mr. Ollerenshaw]74-james ? "[1481-she]

" [I]74-james 'm a - sitting here , "[74-james] [he]74-james replied .

" Well , "[1481-she] said [she]1481-she , " if [you]74-james ca n't find a match , [I]1481-she think [you]74-james had better lead [me]1481-she to the door . [I]1481-she certainly ca n't find [my]1481-she way [there]252-there [myself]1481-she . Where is [your]74-james hand ? "[1481-she]

Then a hand touched [his]74-james shoulder and burnt [him]74-james . " Is that [you]74-james ? "[1481-she] asked the voice .

" Ay ! "[74-james] [he]74-james said .

And [he]74-james took the hand , and the hand squeezed [his]74-james hand - squeezed it violently . It may have been due to fear , it may have been due to mere inadvertence on the part of the hand ; but the hand did , with unmistakable , charming violence , squeeze [his]74-james hand .

And [he]74-james rose .

" What 's that light there ? "[1487-the voice] questioned [the voice]1487-the voice , in a whisper .

" Where ? "[74-james] [he]74-james whispered also .

" There - behind . "[1489-the whispering voice]

[He]74-james turned . A luminance seemed to come from above , from the unseen heights of [the magnificent double staircase]1488-the magnificent double staircase . As [his]74-james eyes grew accustomed to the conditions , [he]74-james gradually made out the details of the staircase .

" [You]74-james 'd better go and see , "[1489-the whispering voice] [the whispering voice]1489-the whispering voice commanded .

[He]74-james dropped the hand and obeyed , creeping up the left wing of [the staircase]1490-the staircase . As [he]74-james faced about at [the half - landing]1491-the half - landing , [he]74-james saw [Helen]79-helen , in an orange - tinted peignoir , and [her]79-helen hair all down [her]79-helen back , holding a candle . [She]79-helen beckoned to [him]74-james . [He]74-james ascended to [her]79-helen .

" Who 's there ? "[79-helen] [she]79-helen inquired , coldly .

" [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter , "[74-james] [he]74-james murmured .

" And are [you]74-james sitting together in the dark ? "[79-helen] [she]79-helen inquired , coldly .

The story that the candle had expired seemed feeble in the extreme . And for [him]74-james the word " cap "[79-helen] was written in letters of fire on the darkness below .

[He]74-james made no attempt to answer [her]79-helen question .

Contents Chapter 24

SEEING A LADY HOME

Those words of [Helen]79-helen 's began a fresh chapter in the life of [[her]79-helen great - stepuncle]1492-her great - stepuncle , [James Ollerenshaw]74-james . [They]1493-they set up in [him]74-james a feeling , or rather a whole range of feelings , which [he]74-james had never before experienced . At tea , [Helen]79-helen had hinted at the direction of [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter 's cap . That was nothing . [He]74-james could not be held responsible for the direction of [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter 's cap . [He]74-james could laugh at that , even though [he]74-james faintly blushed . But to be caught sitting in the dark with [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter , after ten o'clock at night , in [[his]74-james own house]641-his own house ; to have the fact pointed out to [him]74-james in such a peculiar , meaningful tone as [Helen]79-helen employed - here was something that connected [him]74-james and [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter in a manner just a shade too serious for mere smiling . Here was something that had not before happened to [him]74-james in [his]74-james career as [rent - collector and sage]1495-rent - collector and sage .

Not that [he]74-james minded ! No , [he]74-james did not mind . Although [he]74-james had no intention whatever of disputing the possession of [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter with [[her]79-helen stepson]444-her stepson , [he]74-james did not object to all the implication in [Helen]79-helen 's remarkable tone . On the contrary , [he]74-james was rather pleased . Why should not [he]74-james sit with [a lady in the dark]1497-a lady in the dark ? Was [he]74-james not as capable as [any man]418-any man of sitting with [a lady in the dark]1497-a lady in the dark ? [He]74-james was even willing that [Helen]79-helen should credit [him]74-james , or pretend to credit [him]74-james , with having prearranged the dark .

Ah ! [People]304-people might say what [they]304-people chose ! But what a dog [he]74-james might have been had [he]74-james cared to be a dog ! Here [he]74-james was , without the slightest preliminary practice , successfully sitting with [a lady in the dark]1497-a lady in the dark , at the first attempt ! And [what lady]1502-what lady ? Not [the first - comer]1503-the first - comer ! Not [Mrs. Butt]97-mrs. butt ! Not [the Mayoress]1504-the mayoress ! But [the acknowledged Queen of [Bursley]1-bursley]1505-the acknowledged queen of bursley , [the undisputed leader of all that was most distinguished in [Bursley]1-bursley society]1506-the undisputed leader of all that was most distinguished in bursley society ! And no difficulty about it either ! And [she]79-helen had squeezed [his]74-james hand . [She]79-helen had continued to squeeze it . [She]79-helen , in [her]79-helen rich raiment , with [her]79-helen fine ways , and [her]79-helen correct accent , had squeezed the hand of [Jimmy Ollerenshaw]74-james , with [his]74-james hard old clothes and [his]74-james Turkish cap , [his]74-james simple barbarisms , [his]74-james lack of style , and [his]74-james uncompromising dialect ! Why ? Because [he]74-james was rich ? No . Because [he]74-james was [a man]271-a man , because [he]74-james was [the best man in [Bursley]1-bursley]1508-the best man in bursley , when [you]1509-you came down to essentials .

So [his]74-james thoughts ran .

[His]74-james interest in [Helen]79-helen 's heart had become quite a secondary interest , but [she]79-helen recalled [him]74-james to a sense of [his]74-james responsibilities as [great - stepuncle of [a capricious creature like [her]79-helen]1511-a capricious creature like her]1510-great - stepuncle of a capricious creature like her .

" What are [you]74-james and [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter talking about ? "[79-helen] [she]79-helen questioned [him]74-james in a whisper , holding the candle towards [his]74-james face and scrutinising it , as seemed to [him]74-james , inimically .

" Well , "[74-james] [he]74-james said , " if [you]79-helen must know , about [you]79-helen and that there [Andrew Dean]113-andrew . "[74-james]

[She]79-helen made a brusque movement . And then [she]79-helen beckoned [him]74-james to follow [her]79-helen along [the corridor]2125-the corridor , out of possible earshot of [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter .

"[79-helen]

[He]74-james saw instantly that [he]74-james had not been the sage [he]74-james imagined [himself]74-james to be . [James]74-james had the sensation of transacting a part in a play at [a theatre where the scenery was absolutely realistic and at the same time of a romantic quality]1518-a theatre where the scenery was absolutely realistic and at the same time of a romantic quality . Moonlight streaming in through the windows of [the interminable corridor]1519-the interminable corridor was alone wanting to render the illusion perfect . It was certainly astonishing - what [you]1520-you could buy with seven thousand two hundred and fifty pounds ! Perhaps the most striking portion of the scenery was [[Helen]79-helen 's peignoir]1521-helen 's peignoir . [He]74-james had not before witnessed [her]79-helen in a peignoir . The effect of it was agreeable ; but , indeed , the modern taste for luxury was incredible ! [He]74-james wondered if [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter practised similar extravagances .

While such notions ran through [his]74-james head [he]74-james was hurrying to the stairs , and dropping a hail of candle - grease on the floor . [Their]1526-our little plot ! In yielding to the impulse to tell [her]84-mrs. prockter that [Helen]79-helen was unaware of [her]79-helen presence in [the house]475-the house [he]74-james had forgotten that [he]74-james had made it excessively difficult for [him]74-james to demolish the said plot . [He]74-james could not one moment agree with enthusiasm to the plot , and the next moment say that the plot had better be abandoned . [Some men]1528-some men , doubtless , could . But [he]74-james could not . [He]74-james was scarcely [that kind of man]1529-that kind of man . [His]74-james proper course would have been to relate to [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter exactly what had passed between [himself]74-james and [Helen]79-helen , and trust to [her]79-helen common sense . [They]1530-they had touched the ground - floor .

[Curious]155-curious , how sorry [he]74-james felt at this announcement ! [He]74-james had become quite accustomed to being a conspirator with [her]79-helen in [the vast house]1531-the vast house lighted by a single candle , and [he]74-james did not relish the end of the performance .

" [I]74-james 'll step along wi ' [ye]79-helen , "[74-james] said [he]74-james .

" Pooh ! "[74-james] said [he]74-james .

" [You]74-james wo n't need a muffler ? "[79-helen] [she]79-helen suggested .

Now was the moment to play [the hardy Norseman]1533-the hardy norseman . " Oh , no ! "[74-james] [he]74-james laughed .

This concern for [his]74-james welfare , coming from [such a royal creature]1534-such a royal creature , was , however , immensely agreeable .

[She]79-helen stood out on the steps ; [he]74-james extinguished the candle , and then joined [her]79-helen and banged the door . [They]1535-they started . Several hundred yards of [winding pitch - dark drive]1536-winding pitch - dark drive had to be traversed .

" Will [you]74-james kindly give [me]79-helen [your]74-james arm ? "[79-helen] [she]79-helen said .

[She]79-helen said it so primly , so correctly , and with such detachment , that [they]1535-they might have been in [church]1537-church , and [she]79-helen saying : " Will [you]74-james kindly let [me]79-helen look over [your]74-james Prayer Book ? "[79-helen]

When [they]1535-they arrived at [the gas - lit Oldcastle - road]1538-the gas - lit oldcastle - road [he]74-james wanted to withdraw [his]74-james arm , but [he]74-james did not know how to begin withdrawing it . Hence [he]74-james was obliged to leave it where it was .

And as [they]1535-they were approaching the front gate of [the residence of [Mr. Buchanan]156-mr. buchanan]1539-the residence of mr. buchanan , [the Scotch editor of the Signal]1540-the scotch editor of the signal , a perfect string of [people]304-people emerged from that front gate . [Mrs. Buchanan]157-mrs. buchanan had been giving a whist drive . There were sundry Swetnams among the string . And the whole string was merry and talkative . It was a fine night . The leading pearls of the string bore down on [the middle - aged pair]1542-the middle - aged pair , and peered , and passed .

" Good - night , [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter . Good - night , [Mr. Ollerenshaw]74-james . "[953-another couple]

Then [another couple]953-another couple did the same . " Good - night , [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter . Good - night , [Mr. Ollerenshaw]74-james . "[953-another couple]

And so it went on . And the string , laughing and talking , gradually disappeared diminuendo in the distance towards [Bursley]1-bursley .

" [I]84-mrs. prockter suppose [you]74-james know [you]74-james 've done it this time ? "[84-mrs. prockter] observed [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter .

It was a dark saying , but [James]74-james fully understood it . [He]74-james felt as though [he]74-james had drunk champagne . " As well be hung for a sheep as a lamb ! "[74-james] [he]74-james said to [himself]74-james . And deliberately squeezed the royal arm .

Nothing violent happened . [He]74-james had rather expected the heavens to fall , or that at least [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter would exclaim : " Unhand [me]84-mrs. prockter , [monster]2357-monster ! "[84-mrs. prockter] But nothing violent happened .

" And this is [me]74-james , [James Ollerenshaw]74-james ! "[74-james] [he]74-james said to [himself]74-james , still squeezing .

Contents Chapter 25

GIRLISH CONFIDENCES

One afternoon [Sarah Swetnam]107-sarah called , and [Helen]79-helen in person opened the great door to [the visitor]1544-the visitor .

" [I]79-helen saw that frock in Brunt 's three days ago , "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen began , kissing [the tall , tightbound , large - boned woman]1545-the tall , tightbound , large - boned woman .

" [I]107-sarah know [you]79-helen did , [Nell]109-nell , "[107-sarah] [Sarah]107-sarah admitted . " But [you]79-helen need n't tell [me]107-sarah so . Do n't [you]79-helen like it ? "[107-sarah]

" [I]79-helen think it 's a dream , "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen replied , quickly . " Turn round . "[79-helen] But there was a certain lack of conviction in [her]79-helen voice , and in [Sarah]107-sarah 's manner there was something strained . Accordingly , [they]1546-they both became extravagantly effusive - or , at any rate , more effusive than usual , though [each]1409-each was well aware that the artifice was entirely futile .

" All alone ? "[107-sarah] [Sarah]107-sarah asked , when [she]107-sarah had recovered from the first shock of [the hall]2083-the hall 's magnificence .

" [He]74-james 's gone to [Derby]67-derby , to try to buy [some property that [he]74-james says is going very cheap there]2363-some property that he says is going very cheap there . " Well , there was , and there is n't any longer . [Mrs. Wiltshire]158-mrs. wiltshire was the main social prop of [the old rector]2382-the old rector . And the annual concert of [[the St. Luke]117-the st. luke 's Guild]2383-the st. luke 's guild has always been held at [[her]158-mrs. wiltshire house]2384-her house , down at [Shawport]52-shawport , [you]107-sarah know . But even after this final proof of intimate friendship , there still remained an obstinate trifle of insincerity in [their]1553-their relations that afternoon . [Helen]79-helen was sure that [Sarah Swetnam]107-sarah had paid the call specially to say something , and that the something had not yet been said . And the apprehension of an impending scene gradually took possession of [her]79-helen nerves and disarranged [them]1554-them . At last [they]1558-they went out together , two models of style and deportment , and [Helen]79-helen pulled to the great front door with a loud echoing clang .

" Fancy [that place]2397-that place being all empty . Are n't [you]79-helen afraid of sleeping [there]252-there while [[your]79-helen uncle]2399-your uncle is away ? "[79-helen]
