After this example of courageous introspection a silence fell upon [the pair]1559-the pair ; the silence held firm while [they]1558-they got out of [the grounds]1560-the grounds and crossed [Oldcastle - road]1561-oldcastle - road , and took to [the Alls field - path]1562-the alls field - path from which a unique panorama of [Bursley]1-bursley - chimneys , [kilns]1563-kilns , [canals]1564-canals , [railways]1565-railways , and [smoke - pall]1566-smoke - pall - is to be obtained . [Helen]79-helen was determined not break the silence . And then came the moment when [Sarah Swetnam]107-sarah could no longer suffer the silence ; and [she]107-sarah began , very cautiously :

" [I]107-sarah suppose [you]79-helen 've heard all about [Andrew]113-andrew and [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel ? "[107-sarah]

Contents Chapter 26

[THE CONCERT]1570-the concert

On another afternoon [a middle - aged man]1571-a middle - aged man and [a young - hearted woman]1572-a young - hearted woman emerged together from [Bursley Railway Station]69-bursley railway station . [They]1567-they had a little luggage , and [a cab]843-a cab from [the Tiger]1574-the tiger met [them]1567-they by appointment . Impossible to deny that [the young - hearted one]1575-the young - hearted one was wearing a flowered silk under a travelling mantle . [The man]1736-the man , before getting into [the cab]988-the cab , inquired as to the cost of [the cab]988-the cab . The gold angel of [the Town Hall]1579-the town hall rose majestically in front of [him]1736-the man , and immediately behind [him]1736-the man [the Park]188-the park , with [the bowling - green at the top]1581-the bowling - green at the top , climbed [the Moorthorne slope]1582-the moorthorne slope . The bowling season was of course over , but even during the season [he]1736-the man had scarcely played . [He]1736-the man was [a changed person]1583-a changed person . And the greatest change of all had occurred that very morning . Throughout a long and active career [he]1736-the man had worn paper collars . Paper collars had sufficed [him]1736-the man , and they had not shocked [[his]1736-the man friends]1584-his friends . But now [he]1736-the man wore a linen collar , and eleven other linen collars were in [his]1736-the man carpet - bag . Yet it has been said , by [some individual who obviously lacked experience of human nature]1585-some individual who obviously lacked experience of human nature , that [a man]271-a man never changes the style of [his]271-a man collar after forty .

[The cab]988-the cab drove up to [Hillport]23-hillport , and deposited flowered silk and one bag at [the residence of [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter]1588-the residence of mrs. prockter . [It]988-the cab then ascended higher , passing into [the grounds of [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall]1589-the grounds of wilbraham hall , and ultimately stopping at [the grandiose portals thereof , which were wide open]1590-the grandiose portals thereof , which were wide open .

[The occupant of [the cab]988-the cab]1591-the occupant of the cab was surprised to see two other cabs just departing . The next moment [he]1591-the occupant of the cab was more than surprised - [he]1591-the occupant of the cab was startled . [A gentleman in evening dress]1593-a gentleman in evening dress stood at the welcoming doors , and on perceiving [him]1736-the man [this gentleman]1594-this gentleman ran down the steps , and , with a sort of hurried grace , took [his]1736-the man carpet - bag from [him]1736-the man , addressing [him]1736-the man in broken English , and indicating by incomprehensible words and comprehensible signs that [he]1594-this gentleman regarded [him]1736-the man , [the new arrival]1595-the new arrival , as the light of [his]1594-this gentleman eyes and [the protector of [the poor]1597-the poor and of [the oppressed]1598-the oppressed]1596-the protector of the poor and of the oppressed . And no sooner had [he]1594-this gentleman got [the new arrival]1595-the new arrival safe into [the hall]2083-the hall than [he]1594-this gentleman stripped [him]1736-the man of hat , coat , and muffler , and might have proceeded to extremes had not [his]1594-this gentleman attention been distracted by [another vehicle]1601-another vehicle .

[This vehicle]1602-this vehicle contained [the aged rector of [Bursley]1-bursley]1603-the aged rector of bursley .

" Ha ! [Mr. Ollerenshaw]74-james ! "[1604-the divine] cried [the divine]1604-the divine . " [[Your]74-james niece]1974-your niece told [me]1604-the divine only yesterday that [you]74-james were still in [Derby]67-derby buying property , and would not be back . "[1604-the divine]

" [I]74-james 've bought it , [parson]2424-parson , "[74-james] said [James]74-james .

" Ha ! ha ! "[1604-the divine] said [the divine]1604-the divine , rubbing [his]1604-the divine hands . [He]1604-the divine stooped habitually , which gave [him]1604-the divine the air of always trying to glimpse at [his]1604-the divine toes over the promontory of [his]1604-the divine waist . And as [James]74-james made no reply to the remark , [he]74-james repeated : " Ha ! ha ! So [you]1604-the divine decided to come to [[my]74-james concert]2425-my concert , eh ? "[74-james]

" [I]74-james only heard of it yesterday , "[74-james] said [James]74-james .

" Well , "[1604-the divine] said [the divine]1604-the divine , " [I]1604-the divine 'm afraid [they]2426-they 'll be waiting for [me]1604-the divine . Ha ! ha ! This way , is n't it ? [Fine place [you]74-james 've got [here]1785-here]2427-fine place you 've got here . Very fine ! [Noble]159-noble ! "[1604-the divine]

And [he]1604-the divine disappeared through the double doors that led to [the drawing - room]889-the drawing - room , which doors were parted for [him]1604-the divine by [a manikin whose clothes seemed to be held together by new sixpences]1608-a manikin whose clothes seemed to be held together by new sixpences . During the brief instant of opening , a vivacious murmur of conversation escaped like gas from [the drawing - room]889-the drawing - room into [the hall]2083-the hall .

[James]74-james glanced about for [his]74-james bag - it was gone . [The gentleman in evening dress]1611-the gentleman in evening dress was out on the steps . Disheartened by the mysterious annihilation of [[his]74-james old friend]1612-his old friend the bag , [James]74-james , weary with too much and too various emotion , went slowly up the grand staircase . In [[his]74-james bedroom]1320-his bedroom the first thing [he]74-james saw was [his]74-james bag , which had been opened and its contents suitably bestowed . Thus [his]74-james hair - brushes were on the dressing - table . This miracle completed [his]74-james undoing . [He]74-james sat down on an easy - chair , drew the eider - down off the bed , and put it on [his]74-james knees , for the temperature was low . [He]74-james did not intend to go to sleep . But [he]74-james did go to sleep . It was simply a case of nature recovering from emotions .

[He]74-james slept about an hour , and then , having brushed [his]74-james wispish hair , [he]74-james descended [the stairs]1614-the stairs , determined to do or die . Perhaps [he]74-james would not have plumped [himself]74-james straight into [the drawing - room]889-the drawing - room had not [the manikin clad in sixpences]1616-the manikin clad in sixpences assumed that [the drawing - room]889-the drawing - room was [his]74-james Mecca and thrown open the doors .

A loud " Hush ! "[74-james] greeted [him]74-james . [The splendid chamber]1618-the splendid chamber was full of [women]329-women 's hats and [men]331-men 's heads ; but hats predominated . And [the majority of [the audience]918-the audience]1621-the majority of the audience were seated on gilt chairs which [James]74-james had never before seen . Probably there were four or five score gilt chairs . At the other end of [the room]499-the room [the aged rector]1624-the aged rector sat in an easy - chair . [Helen]79-helen [herself]79-helen was perched at the piano , and in front of the piano stood [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel . Except that [the room]499-the room was much larger , and that , instead of a faultless evening dress , [Emanuel]95-emanuel wore a faultless frock - coat with the rest of a suit , the scene reminded [James]74-james of a similar one on the great concertina night at [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter 's .

Many things had happened since then . Still , history repeats itself .

" O Love ! "[95-emanuel] exclaimed [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel , adagio and sostenuto , thus diverting from [James]74-james a hundred glances which [James]74-james certainly was delighted to lose .

And [Helen]79-helen made the piano say " O Love ! "[79-helen] in its fashion .

And presently [Emanuel]95-emanuel was launched upon the sea of [his]95-emanuel yearnings , and voyaging behind the hurricane of passion . And , as usual , [he]95-emanuel hid nothing from [[his]95-emanuel hearers]905-his hearers . Then [he]95-emanuel hove to , and , as it were , climbed to the main - topgallant - sail in order to announce :

" O Love ! "[95-emanuel]

It was not surprising that [his]95-emanuel voice cracked . [Emanuel]95-emanuel ought to have been [the last person to be surprised at such a phenomenon]1627-the last person to be surprised at such a phenomenon . But [he]95-emanuel was surprised . To [him]95-emanuel the phenomenon of that cracking was sempiternally novel and astounding . It pained and shocked [him]95-emanuel . [He]95-emanuel wondered whose the fault could be ? And then , according to [his]95-emanuel habit , [he]95-emanuel thought of [the pianist]912-the pianist . Of course , it was the fault of [the pianist]912-the pianist . And , while continuing to sing , [he]95-emanuel slowly turned and gazed with sternness at [the pianist]912-the pianist . [The audience]918-the audience must not be allowed to be under any misapprehension as to the identity of [the culprit]1632-the culprit . Unfortunately , [Emanuel]95-emanuel , wrapped up , like [the artist [he]95-emanuel was]1633-the artist he was , in [his]95-emanuel performance , had [himself]95-emanuel forgotten the identity of [the culprit]1632-the culprit . [Helen]79-helen had ceased to be [Helen]79-helen ; [she]79-helen was merely [[his]95-emanuel pianist]1635-his pianist . The thing that [he]95-emanuel least expected to encounter when gazing sternly at [the pianist]912-the pianist was [the pianist]912-the pianist 's gaze . [He]95-emanuel was accustomed to flash [his]95-emanuel anger on [the pianist]912-the pianist 's back . But [Helen]79-helen , who had seen [other pianists at work for [Emanuel]95-emanuel]1639-other pianists at work for emanuel , turned as [he]95-emanuel turned , and [their]1640-their eyes met . The collision disorganised [Emanuel]95-emanuel . [He]95-emanuel continued to glare with sternness , and [he]95-emanuel ceased to sing . A contretemps had happened . For the fifth of a second [everybody]302-everybody felt exceedingly awkward . Then [Helen]79-helen said , with a faint , cold smile , in a. voice very low and very clear :

" What 's the matter with [you]95-emanuel , [Mr. Prockter]95-emanuel ? It was n't [my]79-helen voice that cracked . "[79-helen]

The minx !

There was a half - hearted attempt at the maintenance of the proprieties , and then [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall rang with the laughter of a joke which the next day had become the common precious property of all [the Five Towns]193-the five towns . When [the aged rector]1624-the aged rector had restored [[his]1624-the aged rector flock]1644-his flock to a sense of decency [Mr. Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel had vanished . In that laughter [his]95-emanuel career as [a singer]1645-a singer reached an abrupt and final conclusion . The concert also came to an end . And the collection , by which [the divine]1604-the divine always terminated these proceedings , was the largest in the history of [the Guild]1647-the guild .

A quarter of an hour or twenty minutes later [all [the guests]1649-the guests , [members]1650-members , and [patrons of [the St. Luke]117-the st. luke 's Guild]1651-patrons of the st. luke 's guild]1648-all the guests , members , and patrons of the st. luke 's guild had left , most of [them]1648-all the guests , members , and patrons of the st. luke 's guild full of kind inquiries after [Mr. Ollerenshaw]74-james , [the genial host of that so remarkably successful entertainment]1652-the genial host of that so remarkably successful entertainment . The appearances and disappearances of [Mr. Ollerenshaw]74-james had been a little disturbing . First it had been announced that [he]74-james was detained in [Derby]67-derby , buying property . Indeed , [few persons]1653-few persons were unaware that , except for a flying visit in the middle , of two days , to collect [his]74-james rents , [James]74-james had spent a fortnight in [Derby]67-derby purchasing [sundry portions of [Derby]67-derby]1654-sundry portions of derby . Certainly [Helen]79-helen had not expected [him]74-james . Nor had [she]79-helen expected [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter , who two days previously had been called away by telegram to the bedside of [a sick cousin in [Nottingham]70-nottingham]1655-a sick cousin in nottingham . Nor had [she]79-helen expected [Lilian Swetnam]112-lilian , who was indisposed . [The unexpected ladies]1656-the unexpected ladies had not arrived ; but [James]74-james had arrived , as disconcerting as a ghost , and then had faded away with equal strangeness . [None of the departing audience]1657-none of the departing audience had seen even the tassel of [his]74-james cap .

[Helen]79-helen discovered [him]74-james in [[his]74-james little room]1457-his little room at [the end of [the hall]2083-the hall]1659-the end of the hall . [She]79-helen was resplendent in black and silver .

" So here [you]74-james are , [uncle]1867-uncle ! "[79-helen] said [she]79-helen , and kissed [him]74-james . " [I]79-helen 'm so glad [you]74-james got back in time . Can [you]74-james lend [me]79-helen sixpence ? "[79-helen]

" What for , [lass]1738-lass ? "[79-helen]

[He]74-james blenched . But [he]74-james , too , had been expensive in the pursuit of delight . [He]74-james , too , had tiresome trifles on [his]74-james mind . So [he]74-james produced the sixpence , and accepted the dissipation of nearly eight hundred pounds in less than a month with superb silence .

UNKNOTTING AND [KNOTTING]161-knotting

When [Mrs. Prockter]84-mrs. prockter arrived it was obvious to [Helen]79-helen , in spite of [her]79-helen wonderful calm upon discovering [[James Ollerenshaw]74-james 's butler]1672-james ollerenshaw 's butler and page , that [the lady]654-the lady was extremely ill - at - ease . Up to the present [he]74-james had said nothing , because there had been no fair opportunity to say anything But [he]74-james might start at any moment . [She]79-helen argued , with a sure feminine instinct and a large experience of [mankind]907-mankind , that if [he]74-james could only be dodged into tacitly accepting the new scale for even a single meal , [her]79-helen task would be very much simplified . [Mrs. Ollerenshaw]162-mrs. ollerenshaw wept discreetly .

" Bless [us]2468-we ! Bless [us]2468-we ! "[74-james] murmured [James]74-james , not to beseech a benediction , but simply to give the impression quite false that , in [his]74-james opinion , much fuss was being made about nothing .

The new scale of existence was definitely accepted . And in private [Mrs. Ollerenshaw]162-mrs. ollerenshaw entirely agreed with [Helen]79-helen as to the merits of [the butler]1662-the butler .

After dinner [James]74-james hurried to [[his]74-james lair]1682-his lair to search for a book . The book was not where [he]74-james had left it , on [his]74-james original entry into [Wilbraham Hall]34-wilbraham hall . Within two minutes , [the majority of [the household staff]1700-the household staff]1699-the majority of the household staff was engaged in finding that book . Ultimately [the butler]1662-the butler discovered it ; [the butler]1662-the butler had been reading it .

" Ay ! "[74-james] said [James]74-james , opening the volume as [he]74-james stood in front of the rich , expensive fire in [the hall]2083-the hall . " [Dickens]163-dickens - [Charles Dickens]163-dickens - that 's [the chap]2471-the chap 's name . " Could n't [you]74-james play [us]2472-us something ? "[2122-his wife] responded [[his]74-james wife]2122-his wife .

In the triumph of concertinas over grand pianos , [poor Emanuel]95-emanuel , lying wounded [upstairs]1919-upstairs , was forgotten . At five minutes to nine [Helen]79-helen stole , unperceived , away from [the domestic tableau]1706-the domestic tableau . [She]79-helen had by no means recovered from [her]79-helen amazement but [she]79-helen had screened it off by main force in [her]79-helen mind , and [she]79-helen was now occupied with something far more important than the blameless amours of [the richest old man]1707-the richest old man in [Hillport]23-hillport .

By [Wilbraham Water]43-wilbraham water [a young man]1946-a young man was walking to and fro in the deep autumn night . [He]1946-a young man wore a cap and a muffler , but no overcoat , and [his]1946-a young man hands were pushed far down into the pockets of [his]1946-a young man trousers . [He]1946-a young man regarded the ground fixedly , and stamped [his]1946-a young man feet at every step . Then [a pale grey figure , with head enveloped in a shawl]1709-a pale grey figure , with head enveloped in a shawl , and skirts carefully withdrawn from the ground , approached [him]1946-a young man .

[He]1946-a young man did not salute [the figure]1710-the figure , [he]1946-a young man did not even take [his]1946-a young man hands out of [his]1946-a young man pockets . [He]1946-a young man put [his]1946-a young man face close to [hers]79-helen , and [each]1409-each could see that [the other]295-the other 's features were white and anxious .

" So [you]79-helen 've come , "[1946-a young man] said [he]1946-a young man , glumly .

" What do [you]1946-a young man want ? "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen coldly asked .

" [I]1946-a young man want to speak to [you]1946-a young man . That 's what [I]1946-a young man want . If [you]1946-a young man care for [Emanuel Prockter]95-emanuel , why did [you]1946-a young man play that trick on [him]95-emanuel this afternoon ? "[1946-a young man]

" What trick ? "[1946-a young man]

" [You]1946-a young man know perfectly well what [I]1946-a young man mean . So [I]1946-a young man 'll thank [you]1946-a young man not to beat about the bush . The plain fact is that [you]1946-a young man do n't care a pin for [Prockter]84-mrs. prockter . "[1946-a young man]

" [I]1946-a young man never said [I]1946-a young man did . "[1946-a young man]

" [You]1946-a young man 've made [every one]924-every one believe [you]1946-a young man did , anyhow . [You]1946-a young man 've even made [me]1946-a young man think so , though all the time [I]1946-a young man knew it was impossible . [An ass like that]2474-an ass like that ! "[1946-a young man]

" What do [you]1946-a young man want ? "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen repeated .

[They]1713-they were both using a tone intended to indicate that [they]1713-they were [enemies]1714-enemies from everlasting to everlasting , and that mere words could not express the intensity of [their]1713-they mutual hatred and scorn . [The casual distant observer]1715-the casual distant observer might have conceived the encounter to be a love idyll .

There was a short silence .

" [I]113-andrew broke off [my]113-andrew engagement last night , "[113-andrew] [Andrew Dean]113-andrew muttered , ferociously .

" Really ! "[79-helen] [Helen]79-helen commented .

" [You]1946-a young man do n't seem to care . "[113-andrew]

" [I]113-andrew do n't see what it has to do with [me]113-andrew . "[113-andrew]

" Who told [you]1946-a young man [she]112-lilian broke ? "[113-andrew] [Andrew]113-andrew demanded .

" [I]79-helen guessed , "[79-helen] said [Helen]79-helen . " [You]1946-a young man 'd never have had the courage to break it off [yourself]1946-a young man . "[79-helen]

[Andrew]113-andrew made a vicious movement .

" If [you]1946-a young man mean to serve [me]79-helen as [you]1946-a young man served [Emanuel]95-emanuel , "[79-helen] [she]79-helen remarked , with bitter calm , " please do it as gently as [you]1946-a young man can . And do n't throw [me]79-helen far . [I]79-helen can only swim a little . "[79-helen]

[Andrew]113-andrew walked away .

" Good - night , "[79-helen] [she]79-helen called .

" Look here ! "[113-andrew] [he]113-andrew snarled , coming back to [her]79-helen " What 's the matter with [you]79-helen ? But are [you]79-helen going to make that an excuse for spoiling the whole show ? What 's up with [you]79-helen is pride . "[79-helen]

" And what is up with [you]113-andrew ? "[79-helen] [she]79-helen inquired .

" Pride , "[113-andrew] said [he]113-andrew . " How could [I]113-andrew know [you]79-helen were in love with [me]113-andrew all the time ? How could - "[113-andrew]

" [You]113-andrew could n't , "[79-helen] said [Helen]79-helen . " [I]79-helen was n't . No more than [you]113-andrew were with [me]79-helen . "[79-helen]

" If [you]113-andrew were n't in love with [me]113-andrew , why did [you]113-andrew try to make [me]113-andrew jealous ? "[113-andrew]

" [Me]79-helen try to make [you]113-andrew jealous ! "[79-helen] [she]79-helen exclaimed , disdainfully . " [You]113-andrew flatter [yourself]113-andrew , [Mr. Dean]113-andrew ! "[79-helen]

" [I]1716-he can stand a good deal , but [I]1716-he ca n't stand lies , and [I]1716-he wo n't ! "[1716-he] [he]1716-he exploded . " [I]1716-he say [you]79-helen did try to make [me]1716-he jealous . "[1716-he]

[He]1716-he then noticed that [she]79-helen was crying .

The duologue might have extended itself definitely if [her]79-helen tears had not excited [him]1716-he to uncontrollable fury , to that instinctive cruelty that [every male]1717-every male is capable of under certain conditions . Without asking [her]79-helen permission , without uttering a word of warning , [he]1716-he rushed at [her]79-helen and seized [her]79-helen in [his]1716-he arms . [He]1716-he crushed [her]79-helen with the whole of [his]1716-he very considerable strength . And [he]1716-he added insult to injury by kissing [her]79-helen about forty seven times . [Women]329-women are [such strange , incalculable creatures]1719-such strange , incalculable creatures . [Helen]79-helen did not protest . [She]79-helen did not invoke the protection of [Heaven]100-heaven . [She]79-helen existed , passively and silently , the unremonstrating victim of [his]1716-he disgraceful violence .

Then [he]1716-he held [her]79-helen at arm 's length . " Will [you]79-helen marry [me]1716-he ? "[1716-he]

" Yes , "[79-helen] [she]79-helen said .

" Did [you]1716-he try to make [me]1716-he jealous ? "[1716-he]

" Yes . "[1716-he]

Later , as [they]1720-they walked by [the lake]2409-the lake , [he]1716-he ejaculated : " [I]1716-he 'm [an awful brute]2476-an awful brute ! "[1716-he]

" [I]79-helen like [you]1716-he as [you]1716-he are , "[79-helen] [she]79-helen replied .

But the answer was lacking in precision , for at that moment [he]1716-he was being as tender as only [an awful brute]2476-an awful brute can be .

" Of course , "[79-helen] [she]79-helen said , " [we]1720-they must n't say anything about it yet . "[79-helen]

" No , "[1716-he] [he]1716-he agreed . " To let it out at once might make unpleasantness between [you]79-helen and [the Swetnams]151-the swetnams . "[1716-he]

" Oh ! "[79-helen] [she]79-helen said , " [I]79-helen was n't thinking of that . But there 's another love - affair in [the house]475-the house , and [no house]2478-no house will hold two at once . It would be nauseating . "[79-helen]

That is how [they]1720-they talk in [the Five Towns]193-the five towns . As if [one]371-one could have too much love , even in [a cottage]1725-a cottage - to say nothing of [a Wilbraham Hall]1726-a wilbraham hall ! [Mrs. Ollerenshaw]162-mrs. ollerenshaw placidly decided that [she]162-mrs. ollerenshaw and [James]74-james would live at [the Hall]2083-the hall , though [James]74-james would have preferred something a size smaller . As [I]0-i have already noticed , [the staircase]1490-the staircase suited [her]162-mrs. ollerenshaw ; [James]74-james suited [her]162-mrs. ollerenshaw , too . [No one]1076-no one could guess why , except possibly [James]74-james . [They]1720-they got on together , as [the Five Towns]193-the five towns said , " like [a house]729-a house afire . "[1720-they]

[Helen]79-helen and [Andrew Dean]113-andrew were satisfied with [a semi - detached villa in [Park - road]1732-park - road]1731-a semi - detached villa in park - road , with a fine view of the gold angel . [Women]329-women vary , [capricious beings]1734-capricious beings ! [Helen]79-helen is perfectly satisfied with [one servant]2141-one servant . But [she]79-helen dresses rather better than ever .
